description:
Came here around 1pm on a nice Saturday to seat my party of 8. We were actually seated right away outside in the nice patio area! 

Nicole was our waiter and took great care of us.  Here's what I had:

SIDE OF FRUIT - $6.50
My bowl had honeydew, cantaloupe, pineapples, strawberries, and blueberries. It was a decent portion but they were clearly not fresh fruits. You can tell by how withered up they were, like they've been in the fridge for some time now.  They were just okay.

CHEDDAR BACON BISCUIT w/Maple Butter - $6
Oh this was a nice one.  There was enough butter for 5 biscuits. I really liked the sweet maple butter. The biscuit itself was nice and fluffy. 

MISSION-STYLE CHILAQUILES - $15.95
Scrambled Eggs, Tomatillo, Cotija Cheese.
I'm surprised they left out the avocado in the menu description! Everything about this was delicious. I honestly ordered this because of the photos from Yelp. 

My second time here was much better than the first. I highly recommend sitting out on the patio--or I just got lucky it was a lively day out!
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
I love the location, the casual atmosphere and the beautiful bar. I have eaten here many times and attended a friend's memorial in the private room where we were served excellent sliders and fries. 

My last visit was for brunch 2 weeks ago. My husband had a very tasty chorizo, potato and tomato dish. I had the baked eggs in tomato sauce. 
My dish was very bad. The eggs were done well, the yolk soft and creamy but the sauce was terrible. It had large almost inedible chunks of leeks that were difficult to chew and totally incompatible with the creamy eggs. The sauce was so bland. 

Today I made the same dish at home but used sliced red onions, small pieces of bell peppers, serrano peppers, fresh Roma tomatoes, garlic, touch of turmeric, ground cumin, smoked paprika and dried basil to make a delicious smooth sauce. 
Please, please change your sauce. 
Turmeric is the spice du jour.
author: Nina D.

description:
Presidio Social Club is an easy place to eat in the neighborhood. 
Usually meals are sufficient- however the service could use a boost. 
Mostly the food doesn't disappoint and is a general great place for a date, family gathering, etc
author: Lauryn H.

description:
Funny how I wrote, "I'll revisit this rating when the food gets better" after my last visit. Well, that was over 11 years ago, and that was also my first visit. In the intervening years, friends had told me the food got better and the atmosphere got toned down from its former banana plantation vibe. So when I was thinking of a place to dine after an intimate wedding at the Palace of Fine Arts. This hit me since I knew parking would be a cinch and we could even walk over if we were so inclined. There were 11 of us, so I made a reservation a couple of days prior and they accommodated us with a long table smack dab in the middle (photo: http://bit.ly/2HGcXc1).

The menu was straight-ahead American reasonably priced but more elegantly executed than what I recalled. We shared a trio of appetizers, first with the $8 PSC Gruyere Cheese Toast with a tomato fondue dip (photo: http://bit.ly/2JHgEDF), a more upscale rendering of a long-ago after-school snack, and then with the irresistible $8 Deviled Eggs topped with white sturgeon caviar (photo: http://bit.ly/2sSk1xD). Deviled eggs are as foolproof a satisfier as you can get. The third share was the $7 Smashed Peas with mint oil (photo: http://bit.ly/2JGpUEH), a treatment of green peas I've never had before but to which I became instantly addicted. What a great risk-averse start to our post-wedding meal.

Jamie W. ordered the $32 Fish of the Day, which was a Grilled Swordfish which was accompanied by a fresh corn salsa and a ratatouille mix of mushrooms, spinach, and cherry tomatoes (photo: http://bit.ly/2t3FLpA). Delicious old-school seafood. I went a little healthier with the $21 Roasted & Grilled Spring Vegetables with Green Farro - carrots, asparagus, snap peas, and red onions mixed with a romesco sauce and topped with creme fraiche (photo: http://bit.ly/2JybrP9). It was more satisfying than a veggie dish has a right to be. As the rest of our party devoured protein-dominant fare like the meatloaf, grilled liver, and bavette steak, we considered our dessert options as it was that kind of celebration. Among all of us, we slammed four of the five specialty desserts.

The $10 Dark Chocolate Brownie was what you would hope, a generous hunk of rich goodness slathered in ganache and topped with a scoop of toasted almond ice cream and candied almonds (photo: http://bit.ly/2sQAbYu). The $9 slice of Lemon Meringue Cake was a classic smash-up of pie and cake school cafeteria-style (photo: http://bit.ly/2JBaE00), and the $9 PSC Butterscotch Pudding was of the same classic ilk with a dark chocolate sauce and crème Chantilly effortlessly replacing the Nestle and Reddi Wip (photo: http://bit.ly/2t2T0XM). The only marginal disappointment were the $9 Brioche Beignets which were chewier than I liked for fancy donuts even with the addition of a brown sugar hot chocolate for dipping (photo: http://bit.ly/2JthMey). What a nice leisurely celebration with non-controversial dishes that fit the occasion.

FOOD - 4 stars...all-American dishes nicely rendered for immediate satisfaction
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...much brighter and whiter than when they first opened
SERVICE - 4 stars...attentive even as the place started filling up
TOTAL - 4 stars..."I'll revisit the rating when the food gets better"...check!
author: Ed U.

description: Great service... burgers with truffle fries were a hit!!! The restaurant still kept the old time charm, you can still see the bones of the military remnants but modernized it. Server was friendly and attentive. Definitely will go back and refer friends and family.... the truffle fries were amazing don't pass on this!!!
author: Jennifer D.

description: If you're ordering the rib eye steak for two, keep in mind that the person you're sharing with should want their steak cooked the same way as you. The rib eye steak for two will come out sliced on a large plate and then your choice of two sides. I recommend the truffle fries and broccoli or mash potatoes. I did not like the string beans. Not sure how they're cooked but it had a fishy taste.
author: Mai N.

description:
Reservation was made for dinner at 7pm. 
We were seated by the windows with a great view.
Great. Soon thereafter the waitress came to take our orders. Somehow she was kind of pushy to oversell drinks and foods we did not want.
We ordered both their PSC hamburger with the truffle fries. We knew the overprice of the burger and we were expected something special. It came out to be on par with McDo which even serves better garlic fries.

The waitress came back soon after we just finished and gave us our bill. How rude was that. We know that she needs to clear our table for the next guests. Probably that we did not order more than she would have wanted to get more tips. Obviously she wanted us to leave the restaurant. For that we did not leave too much of a tip. We would not come back there even for the view.
author: Joe E.

description:
Had a family get together with 12people.  We had reservations for a Saturday brunch and were seated promptly. Drink order was served quickly and we had time to talk, look at the menu and get reaquiainted.  The menu was diverse for our family and everyone enjoyed beniets, coffee and fried banana's.  
For brunch we ordered everything from the quiche, cinnamon rolls, eggs with pork belly and French toast.  All superb.
I would go back both a large group and with just my wife.
author: Cliff S.

description:
After all the super strong reviews for brunch I really expected a lot more.

The poke simply wasn't fresh. The texture of the fish was gummy and too cold and it was drenched in soy.

The beignets were lacking. There are many better across the city.

I was a fan of the meatloaf though. The flavor was very good with a really nice gravy flavor.

Service was nice and friendly. Atmosphere and location was really good.

Mostly I was just underwhelmed by the food.
author: Tarek S.

description:
We wanted to love this place with amazing location and decor. We came for a birthday celebration. We were having a lovely time sitting by the window enjoying the cool break from the inland summer heat. Out came our meals except for one. We waited a few minutes for the last to arrive, but it didn't so we went ahead and started. The fries and one of the entrees were cold. The special finally came after 10 minutes. We had really good desserts and left being a little upset, but not enough to write a poor review. 

As we were driving to Ocean Beach my mom said we had to turn back because we had been charged incorrectly. After going over the bill with the manager we were double charged for the special and charged for an extra meal. If it was just a couple of things we would have let it go, but unfortunately it wasn't. The manager did credit us back what we were owed. Make sure if your food is cold then return it, don't accept late food, and double check your bill.
author: Carolyn B.

description: The Social Club is an old-school bar and restaurant with an old-school feel. Most of the army barracks fixings are still up, and it looks like the interior hasn't been touched up too much since those days, but the service is impeccable, and the food isn't bad at all. Prices are a little on the higher end, but if you're coming in for a little bit after work, you can grab a few beers/cocktails while watching the game (2 small TVs on each end of the bar). If you have a larger group, they'll personally cater to you in a separate, private room with your own personal menu. You almost feel like you're in another time period. Steaks are cooked perfectly medium rare, and desserts come in trays. I would love to come back.
author: Danny C.

description:
I came here for an event. For parking, you have to have a permit to park there, if you do not have a permit, there are pay stations that you can put in money for every two hours. The signs were confusing because it said you have to have a permit everyday. But on the pay station, it said you have to pay only for Monday thru Friday. It didn't specify on for weekends. But it's better to pay than not to. 
Besides the parking, the food was good. Since it was an event we got a separate menu course. Also a bottle of white wine from Austria was ordered. I got a lentil soup, chicken salad sandwich, and chef's choice of dessert. The sides that our table had was French fries and macaroni and cheese. The food was really good here! The service was good too! They were all nice too!
author: Carola S.

description: Excellent service. Special tonight was the Dover Sole whole fish melted in your mouth. Meatloaf was was very good and the truffle fries are a must! Great atmosphere. A must try when in the San Fran area.
author: Cindy D.

description:
EVENT: It's a social event - hanging out with some friends and our mentors... it's such a cute little place with outdoor seating and the indoors is such sweet ambience. It was just a perfect night in SF!

SERVICE: We made reservations and got seated shortly we checked in. Service was lovely and wonderful! 

FOOD:
(1) Mac & Cheese - maybe I had some hunger pains... it tasted delish! It def made the pain go away!
(2) Eggplant fries - all I have to say is like WOW - eggplant never tasted sooo good. But, really anything fried is good.. LOL
(3) Cherry tomato bruschetta - little bread pieces and drench delish tomato-cream sauce on it - it was the best
(4) Fish of the day - Rockfish, came in a thin, big slice and grilled. My friend had this and she highly recommend it!
(5) Grilled bavette steak - this is the dish I ordered cause I LOVEEE steak! LOVEE! This was my 3rd time having steak this week and I can't get enough! Well made! I asked for Medium Rare and it came out perfectly! Came with pan fried tomatoes and potatoes and it was sooo filling! 

DRINKS:
Barbera - I'm shocked to find this wine! It's never listed in any restaurants! It worked well with my steak! LOVE IT

**OVERALL: if you're looking for a place to take friends from out of town for a nice dinner and drinks - this is a great place. Highly recommended! 4.5 stars!!!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
About to cross the Golden Gate Bridge and hungry for a family-friendly dining option nearby? Two families, four kids and two cars in a city full of hipsters and privileged millennials. Well wouldn't you know it we were in exactly that situation. We called ahead to confirm and reserve the big table and headed to the Presidio Social Club. 

The ambiance was great. There was plenty of parking, the fog had lifted, the Presidio grounds were amazing, the PSC patio was gorgeous and we had a great round white-tablecloth location by a big bright window in a room with other families. Yup - kids room - I don't mind when restaurants put us off to the side so long as the accommodations and service are equivalent. Service was fine. There isn't a kid menu, per se, but three of the kiddos split 2 "classics" mac n cheese orders at $13 a pop, the 4th had the $15 burger and all split a side of the $8 steamed broccoli, which was really broccolini. Nothing was cheap, but there were kid-friendly options. 

The adult food was fine but unexceptional. We started with deviled eggs that we thought were average and under-seasoned except for what tasted like an explosion of celery salt. My entree was better - I had a $19 bucatini pasta dish with a diavolo sauce that I really enjoyed, although it was a bit one-note and it was sort of wanting for a protein addition. My wife tried to go light and had a similarly ok poke appetizer. Our adult friends had a kale salad with chicken, and a $19.50 meatloaf. 

The shared desserts were a high point. We had a great s'mores dish, a midnight chocolate pie and two orders of very churro-like beignets. Finished on a high note.
author: Michael S.

description: Great "California" atmosphere, including a nice outdoor patio. We went with our kids for Saturday brunch. Good place for kids. Food was good, but not great. Hamburger a little over cooked. Yummy truffle French fries.  Came back a second time with a group of 12...great for groups!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
You know you've made it if you end up in the Presidio. It's a great area, and the Presidio Social Club is no exception.

My family rented out a room here for a few hours. Service was fast and friendly - they constantly swung by and asked if I wanted another drink. Parking was a bit of a pain, but I'd love to come back here some other time.
author: Casey S.

description: Food is great here. Atmosphere is very nice as well as is the location in the park. The only thing they could improve on is their wine list. This Is California after all
author: Kevin K.

description:
So came here for dinner, it definitely isn't a two dollar sign level. It's expensive. Everything is expensive. So maybe two dollar signs to most of the people in that area.
We weren't aware of the split plate charge. We got meatloaf, which was good. Not 24$ good, but good. We started with deviled eggs, decent and truffle fries that we ended up sending back. They were so fried that they hurt our teeth. 
The drinks were good and our server was great. Out of curiosity I had to see the dessert menu, we agreed on the butterscotch pudding... The chocolate sauce over powered any resemblence of butterscotch flavor. Overall a disappointment.
author: Kathie C.

description:
The ambiance is VERY brunch-at-the-club. But we're still Bay Area here, so plenty of people dressed casually.

I got the daily special, a $15 catfish sandwich. It was okay. My friends ordered the truffle garlic fries and I stole some. Those were pretty good, but the richness gets to you after about 10.
author: Annie C.

description:
Came here with friends for a spontaneous brunch and it was such a good choice. We sat in their outdoor patio and when the rest of SF was foggy and cold- their patio was sunny, warm and perfect! 
The food was also spectacular. We couldn't chose between their fritters or beignets so we got both
And there was parking!
Sunny and has parking! Was I even in SF?!
author: Julianna I.

description: The oven roasted ribeye for two was amazing and the waitress was fantastic.   Professional on point with everything.  Love the country home feel. Will go back again.
author: David W.

description: Love the setting and ambience.  Food was good, not the best I've had (eggs benedict).  Rum drink called a 'Painkiller' was delicious OMG!  Our waiter was the reason for the 3 star review.  He was rather off putting, verging on rude.  Literally tossed our bill on the table as he walked by without asking if we needed anything else, how was our food etc. etc..  No people skills whatsoever.  Other than that, I will visit again and give it a second try.
author: N R.

description:
I was here for dinner on a Thursday. Reservation was for 6:15.

I got the PSC hamburger with cheese and truffle fries. The burger was average which made it very overpriced. The fries were pretty good. 

The waitress was not super friendly but did her job. It would have been a solid 3 Star experience if it wasn't for the hostess. At 8pm, she came over, interrupted our conversation and asked us if we planned on staying for much longer because there are others waiting for a table. I cannot recall the last time I was asked to leave a restaurant. This was not a NYE kind of day when it's understandable for restaurants to be super busy and need a rapid turnover. Usually under those circumstances, you are warned when making a reservation that they need the table back in 2 hours. This was a random Thursday evening! I would not come back if they were giving out filet mignon for free! I'll get my pretentious average tasting overpriced burger elsewhere!
author: Connie S.

description:
I try to visit the City as often as possible, but my family is far-flung, so at least three times each year, my family visits San Francisco as a central spot for seeing one another.  

We have our regular haunts, including the PSC, where we like to have a well-made cocktail, an old school hamburger or one of our favorite meat loaf sandwiches, stroll the grounds and talk, and enjoy a slice of "Old San Francisco" before we head out into the city for a day of activities.

We already loved this charming and historic location, the terrific restaurant and bar with great food without the mortgage-required prices, and because it has very fond memories for our family. 

From our earliest visits to the City in the 1960s and 70s, and thereafter, when my brother shipped in and out of the harbor and visited the city on his RR weekends.  He loves and shares the memories he has every time he sits in the PSC. It's like delicious time-travel experience.

But now we love it even more, because the team at PSC, including its GM Steve and others, really went out of their way to help me make a very special moment happen for my family, at my request. They could not have been kinder, and more helpful with their time and generous in granting a favor -- and they are surely part of the reason this place exudes  such a cool and wonderful vibe -- because the people behind the scenes have it.

If you have a special event you'd like to host in San Francisco -- this is an ideal venue for it.

Thank GM Steve and the entire team who made my family feel so appreciated!
author: K C.

description: Pretty atrocious service. Nearly everything we ordered was messed up. When our waiter would get something wrong, he would disappear in the kitchen for 20 minutes at a time and then still bring out the wrong thing in replacement. All of our food was cold by the time he brought out the condiments. Quite overpriced for such terrible service and meh food.
author: Mackenzie B.

description:
I came here as part of a group birthday at 2pm (getting towards the end of peak).  There were a few mistakes on the mains, which is sometimes to be expected, but my order in particular (meatloaf) did not come out. I was told that my food was being plated, so I didn't worry. However, it took another 25 minutes before my food came out, and my friends had already finished their mains. 

It turns out, the meatloaf was undercooked and cold in the middle... a real no-no for meat. I spoke to the manager about it, who graciously took the dish off the bill. However, she came back two minutes later to tell me that the food wasn't cold... a very curious thing to debate (not to mention figure out).  I'm actually quite flabbergasted that she would even try to debate this point - I wasn't going to eat cold meat. 

Unfortunately, this spoiled the mood for the rest of the meal - I understand mistakes happen, but her comments were completely unnecessary. I expected more from an establishment like this.
author: Edward S.

description:
The service was so bad here!  We came at 4pm, so not a busy time at all, for a party of 9.  Our waiter wasn't accommodating at all when we asked for something to be on the side.  It took so long for the food to come out, and we saw all the waiters hanging around and ignoring their customers.

The food was meh - my kale salad with poached tuna was tasteless, and the tuna tasted like it was from out of a can.

The fries were good, and the desert were decent.

For the price, definitely would not recommend!
author: Nicole S.

description: We recently moved to the hood so wanted to try PSC. Split a salad, some cheese toast and deviled eggs with a couple of beers. An espresso (smallest espresso ever by the way) and a couple of deserts. Food was very good, not great and our check was $90 w/tip. Just can't connect what we had with the price, so this unfortunately won't be on our list of local favs. Too bad :-(
author: Alan R.

description:
We ate lunch here on a Thursday and had a wonderful time.  We were greeted with a warm smile and the hostess asked if we would like to sit in the semi private dining room because it was quieter.  I was impressed by the thoughtfulness.

Alex was our server and he was outstanding.  He suggested the eggplant fries and they were great.  Lightly fried and soaking in honey.  I had the arugula chicken salad and it was perfectly dressed.  I would definitely order it again.  One person at the table had the liver and onions and really enjoyed it.  She would have preferred a crispy onion choice, but enjoyed the dish with the caramelized onions. The other person had the meatloaf and she enjoyed it as well.  They both had dessert.  One the pecan pie and the other the ice cream sundae.  I didn't taste either, but they both cleaned their plates.
author: Jan F.

description: Been there three times. Good place for weekday lunch. Weekends are quite busy. Good parking. Comfortable atmosphere, clean and cheerful. Good food but some inconsistency. Service depends on the waiter, could be more friendly.
author: Gene L.

description: Wow, is the host rude. This used to be my go-to brunch place (pretty, decent food, easy to make reservations), but today I just walked out. During the simple act of checking in for my reservation, this woman interrupted me three times, "honey"ed me twice, and then (although the place was empty at 10:30 am, and also open table showed that they had tons of free slots) made a big deal about seating us. This is the face they want on their restaurant? Really?
author: Cara W.

description: We had a great Sunday brunch here except for the lack of "bottomless" mimosas...$100 for 3 people seemed a bit much. Other than that, this was a fab experience. Food and service were excellent. Eggs Benedict, ahi, chilaquiles were all devoured as was the gruyere grilled cheese! Yummy! This is a special spot and we totally enjoyed it.
author: susie m.

description:
Super disappointed. 
I would like to preface by saying that I rarely write bad reviews but I can't stop thinking about how bad the service was at PSC.

I have been here a couple times before and had a decent time and the food was good. 

Today's experience was one for the books. We were left sitting at our table for several minutes before our drink order was taken. They brought out a very poor excuse for an espresso martini (a chilled glass of Kailua) and then brought out the wrong bottle of wine. Our food was brought out before or drinks! There's more...

1) two of our meals were cold
2 our appetizer fries were brought out when they dropped our check lol

We didn't complain about any of this and we were just going to pay the check and leave. Our group of 8 wanted to split the check cash and cards but then were informed that we couldn't do so. I mentioned that based on how horrible the service was that they should make an exception. The server said "well in that case, we definitely can't split the check". I 
asked for the manager. 

The manager came over and asked what the issue was. I said there were several issues including the servers attitude. He then proceeded to ask me to list everything! Then he gave us a mediocre apology with an excuse "sorry, we've already printed your checks so there isn't anything else I can do". It was the most unprofessional service we have ever experienced. I can't believe this place is in business. So sad too because of the great ambiance and location. I would never set foot in this establishment again and I will definitely be sure to share this experience with all of my friends near and far.
author: Natalie m.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here last night for Valentine's Day and it was largely a disappointment. It's hard to screw up truffle fries, so those were fine, and the dipping sauces were great. The dessert (apple and pear strudel with cinnamon ice cream) was also flaky and delicious. Old fashioned was also fine.

Unfortunately, the menu is sorely lacking vegetarian entrees (only two) so we settled on the spaghetti, and brussel sprouts on the side.

The spaghetti had virtually no flavor. A touch of olive oil and salt, maybe. The cauliflower might have been boiled. No seasoning that I could detect. This was one of the typical vegetarian dishes where the menu designer shrugs his/her shoulders and says, throw some spagetti in with an assortment of veggies, like pasta primavera. No thought to it and it tasted like it.

The brussels were wayyyy underroasted-and it's like chewing steak if they are that tough. Really, really hard. They should be lightly chewy. They were advertised as brussels with sage. I could detect no sage at all.  I had to re-heat both the leftover brussels and spaghetti with a spoonful of pesto, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and garlic today for lunch to make it even decent.

I would really advise the staff to check on their seasoning for these dishes, and think about another vegetarian entrée or two. We're happy to order an assortment of veggie sides, of which there are many, and call that dinner, but others aren't.
author: Adam B.

description:
This place has tasty food. Make a reservation for busy hours. My dinner pals got the chicken and the meatloaf and enjoyed their meals. 

I LOVED the eggplant fries with honey. Mmmmmm. So unique! This is one thing I'd highly recommend trying! 

Had the pesto pasta with pork and a farm egg. The pork was different than I predicted - pretty big chunks of pork that were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
author: Sela B.

description: Really great location, the building has the vintage feel with a more modern interior, very good atmosphere. Food was quite good, had a banh mi style sandwich that was excellent, beer selection is good. It was a gorgeous day and so we got to sit outside and while it enhanced the dining experience for our lunch, service was VERY slow. Not bad, we got anything we needed or asked for, but we ran out of drinks and never had our server come back until they brought the check. So service was okay, but slow, until food came and then we were forgotten. It happens, they were fairly busy, wouldn't deter me from coming back, food was still excellent.
author: Josh M.

description:
I'm giving it two stars based on service. Our waiter through out the whole dinner kept pressuring us to order our apps / main dinner / and dessert. It felt extremely rushed. 

Then after we got our check one person in the party signed the check and the hostess came over looked at the receipt he signed. Then looked at the other one that wasn't signed. She then hovered over us to sign and add a tip to the other one. It was very rude and made us really uncomfortable. 

Next time they should know to wait to get the receipts when the party leaves.
author: Courtney O.

description: I usually come here for desserts. The Pistacho Cannoli is my favorite one, although it's really rich. The Butterscotch Pudding is terrific too and the Dark Chocolate Brownie is a million times better than any other brownie I have tried. Any person who has a sweet has to try this place!
author: Amy H.

description:
After reading mixed reviews I was nervous but this place turned out to be wonderful. Our waitress, miranda, was wonderful. We made our orders super complicated but she got it all right.
Chilaquiles were one of the best we have ever had. Pork belly was great. The vietnamese soup was great too. Patio seating was beautiful   Very friendly staff and a lovely restaurant.
author: Heather S.

description: We came here for sisters brunch on an overcast SF day, and still had a great time. Food A+. Service A+. Cinnamon roll with extra icing A++ (it's cool just park further away and do some lunges to the car). We ordered the meatloaf, the Vietnamese sandwich with pork belly and the chilequiles all delicious. The rose sangria was good but maybe better on a warmer day, and the  Pain Killer is full of the liquor so go ahead and order those carbs.
author: Rachel E. C.

description:
I love love love PSC. It's such a solid go-to spot, with consistently good food, service and cocktails, and they almost always have last minute reservations available. They also serve a mean brunch, which I value highly.

They're very accommodating with bulky strollers, although you do have to find a way to get the stroller up and down the front stairs (you might be able to wheel it right in through the back patio, but I've never tried).

I've never had a bad dish here. Some of my favorite things to order are the truffle fries the little grilled cheese sandwich strips that you dip in tomato soup, oysters, meatloaf (try it - it's delicious), and the seasonal pastas. You really can't go wrong!
author: Connie S.

description: The best dinner and service in a great setting! What a delightful evening. We had the oysters on the half shell, which couldn't have been fresher or more flavorful. The ahi was so tender and delicious that I am still thinking about it. My husband had the braised short ribs and was about to kick his plate. They were perfect. Our server was friendly, personable, efficient, and helpful. We have already recommended PSC to family and friends. We can't wait to go back.
author: Jean M.

description:
This is definitely a nice place to stop and have an amazing cocktail anytime midday thru the evening. We strolled in for lunch, first thoughts were "This place is pretty swanky." White table cloths, attentive, very professional, timely service, great list of their favorite cocktails. Any place that leads a cocktail list with a gin French 75 knows what's up behind the bar. I had a French 75 and a couple of Old Cubans (basically a French 75 made with rum), they were great cocktails. The bar gets 5 stars. 
The waitress, a Julia Stiles look alike, provided great service worth 5 stars! She was professional, timely, real people. 
Sadly the food was fair at best. We started with the fois gras and chicken liver pate, definitely needed salt and pepper at least, and a new recipe at best. 
We also had the deviled eggs with caviar. The caviar shined but again the deviled eggs needs seasoning of salt and pepper.  
I had the lamb ragu pasta, which was pretty good after I heavily salted and peppered the dish. My lovely wife had a cheese burger with bacon and truffle fries. The bacon was the only star here. It sadly seams all the food that earlier needed salt didn't have it because it all ended up on her truffle fries.  The worst part of presentation was the tomatoes on the side, one of the slices was literally the tomato top where the stem attaches. Ruining the presentation of a $20 burger.
Good thing a 5 star waitress, cocktail list, and the building's nostalgic value and ambiance bring the 2 star food up to a 3 star dining experience. 
I should also point out the cost rating should be changed from $$ to $$$ or $$$$. Two appetizers, 2 lunch entrees, and cocktails $150. Not complaining just not expected. 
We salute the veterans of this fine country. Hoorah to the brave folks that have kept this great country free!!
author: Mark V.

description:
To preface: I have been to Presidio Social Club several times before, food has been ok, service so so but location and atmosphere are great.



Today's lunch experience: 4 of us ordered our meals with a side of truffle fries to share. Fries came first (we did not ask for them as an appetizer), our  meals arrived well over an hour after ordering. I ordered a burger medium-rare, it came our rare and with a side of avocado I did not order but was charged for. My husband's burger was ordered medium but came out well done. All the food was very average.



I rarely write reviews, sharing this experience not because of the wait or food quality but because of the way the situation was handled;



1. Our server was nowhere near our table for the duration of the wait, did not offer more drinks or let us know the food was delayed. Nor did he apologize until I gave feedback much later when the check came

2. The manager came out with a bowl of fruit after an hour's wait and to let us know the food was coming but did not apologize

3. When I asked why the food was delayed the manager waved her arm around and informed me they had lots of people in the restaurant who all ordered food at the same time



Horrible experience and attitude. Won't be going back.
author: Lena S.

description: Went there for dinner and the food was great however our waitress was so ditsy.  We brought in our own wine and of course we knew of the cork fee of $25.00.   The meatloaf was amazing and the fish that the others in my party had was delicious.  The only complaint was the poor service and waitress was not professional at all.  She kept coming over and pouring us more wine from the bottle that we brought in.  Not friendly at all and she put on a superficial front. ( maybe she hates her job)
author: Jane K.

description: In a word...Wow. It's soooo refreshing in this day and age to have the full dining experience when the food, decor, and service all come together and put a huge smile on your face. Monday night at the Presidio Social Club was a special night out for me and my guest. We started with a caviar deviled egg appetizer and butter lettuce salad . The main meal was similarly mouth watering. I had the ribeye steak (cooked just right) and truffle fries. Truth be told it was too much food for one person. Our server Nicole didn't hesitate to box up my leftovers and then recommended the coconut tres leches and lemon meringue cake (no calories of course ). This was our first visit to the PSC but will definitely not be our last.
author: Jeff D.

description: Went for beer fest NorCal vs SoCal and man they had a great turn out. Amazing beers on tap. Most you could serve yourself so it was dope. Some that tasted like champagne and some like whiskey. But there were only a couple that were a bit out of my taste preference. Overall this was a great place to check out during the brew fest here in the city.
author: Jacob N.

description:
If you are considering going to PSC for a special occasion, I would highly recommend that you think again. I have been to PSC many times over the years and with each passing year the quality of the food and regrettably the quality of the service declines. 

Today was another example of their lackluster approach to service. I planned a reservation at PSC x 1 month ago; informed them it was a birthday celebration and on arrival the host did lackadaisically acknowledge that it was someone's birthday and that was it. The server who clearly hated his job, never wished my child a happy birthday, acted annoyed to be at work the entire duration of our meal,  never once approached us to see how the meal was or asked if we needed anything. Did not offer any suggestions for the meal or suggest any specials. While this is not a high end restaurant, the price point is such that I would expect better service and have received better service there in the past.

This awful service might have been forgiven had the quality of the food served been stellar. Alas, it was not. Bland is the best adjective that I can use to describe our meal. If I have to season my food after it is delivered to me ina a restaurant, you have already failed as a chef! I have no idea why people keep patronizing this restaurant.  It is a ghost of the establishment it used to be and that is sad, because at one point PSC was terrific. Well today, you lost a patron. 

Thankfully there are many establishments in SF to take your place. Service still counts PSC! And if you aren't going to provide good service then at very least elevate the quality of the food that you serve!
author: Halima T.

description: The hostess Marjorie was absolutely horrible... we went with our baby and she said she would not seat us. The place was half empty and we've been here many times with our son. She was rude, mean, and not welcoming at all we are done with this place! Hire a host who greets people nicely
author: Austin L.

description:
We had mother's day brunch here.  The hostesses were excellent - really worked hard to get us the table we needed because my elderly mother was with us.  It went downhill from there.  The primary issue was our waitress.  She was mostly absent, fairly dour when she did appear, and offered absolutely no value.  She spilled some water when pouring it just after we sat down -- she silently proceeded to move some silverware off a napkin onto another napkin, using the first napkin to clean up the spill.  Never said a word, never brought another napkin.  This was basically her approach for the entire meal.  Hopefully she'll read this so she knows why she received a 10% tip.
Hamburger was pretty good, Chilaquiles were a sloppy mess.
We'll go back for drinks at the bar but that's it.
author: Pat H.

description:
Went here for an early dinner following the Cider Fest in the Presidio. It was a bit overpriced in my opinion for the quality and taste of the food. We just wanted to try it out to see the drinks they offered and their food options. We made reservations which worked out for us, but there seemed to be plenty of seating.

I wasn't disappointed at the food all that much, but the service was also less than I wanted as well. My wine was knocked over and the waiter didn't offer to help clean up or offer me another glass- that was disappointing to me. 

Our waiter didn't seem interested in us at all and wasn't very warm, but we just ate our meal and drank our wine and left the restaurant. It's beautiful restaurant in the Presidio though so the view is great and it has it's own small parking lot.

I don't think I would come back here, unfortunately.
author: Bori B.

description: Good food but awful service. I will definitely not be back. The waitress seemed irritated, cold and not very welcoming. She was nice to the table next to us which we found very strange
author: Cathy M.

description:
We had a group ladies lunch on May 3. Everybody loved what they ordered: the chicken soup was tasty, salads well seasoned and fresh. I had the Cuban sandwich - the dipping sauce made it for me.

Service was friendly and prompt. We all would return!
author: Donna E.

description: We took a friend from Moldova to lunch there. Over the years, we have been satisfied with the food, but we all gave it a "5" yesterday. Service was pleasant but lacked followup. Hence the "4" rating. We had the Vietnamese vegetarian sandwich and the special of the day roast beef sandwich. The sauces were what made the food standout. The décor still reminds us of a banana plantation, with some of the rattan chairs in need of repair. It is charming and parking was easy.
author: L G.

description: Neat setup with a retro style bar and great ambiance. It was too cold to eat outside, but I did take a peak at the back patio, which would be nice place to unwind on a warm day. Our waitress was very attentive and helpful. The menu just was a little lackluster, and we we not overly excited about anything that we ordered. Would love to come back for a drink on the patio.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Two stars for the food, extra star for service. Hostess was very accommodating to seat us away from the boisterous bar area and our server was helpful to explain portion sizes. It's the food that was lacking. I understand they're going for upscale American comfort food but it just wasn't anything memorable.

Deviled eggs - ***
Truffle fries - **** (yum!)
Sunday dinner special - ** (too tough / too pricey)
Beef liver & onions - **** (best entree)
House made pasta - ** (nice sauce but had to return due to undercooked pasta)

Would I return? Probably not especially at the price for the quality. It's too bad because the location in the Presidio is something special.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I am an event planner and had one of my brides receptions here yesterday, it was my first time here and such a great experience! The restaurant itself is so cute and very well decorated and clean! 

My bride rented out the patio and extra area with the little bar where cocktail hour was. The staff was all so nice and helpful when setting up. They helped us and made sure everything was clean and right for our bride and groom. Gio was amazing and was so patient with us and so informative, he was very tentative the entire reception and got us what we needed right away when asked. There was a lady there also I forgot her name but she was a manager I believe who came around consistently to make sure drinks were full, food was good and everyone was ok. Bartender at the time did a great job and was very talkative to people which everyone loved. 

Food was delicious and brought out quickly and in orderly fashion. Atmosphere was beautiful! Weather was nice and patio is set up perfectly for an afternoon lunch. 

I will definitely be back and plan on doing other events here!! Thank you again for making yesterday go smoothly!
author: Adriana B.

description: Love this place. Makes you feel like your in the suburbs surround by trees and grass. Food is fantastic and so is the bar. Highly recommend their classic meatloaf which comes with carrots and mashed potatoes.
author: Ken M.

description:
Normally I enjoy eating here although it is crowded and noisy on Sundays. Great comfort food and full bar. Food was, as usual, fine and so was our server. My issue is with the hostess. Granted it was crazy busy, but she barely greeted us and then couldn't find our reservation. I showed her my Open Table confirm, and she ignored me. Then snapped that she found it, but she hadn't, and she walked away to take care of someone else. Talk about attitude! 

Then someone without a reservation came in and the host seated them. When the hostess cam back to the desk, I told her and she was all apologies and nicey-nice. Seriously? Worst service from her. Tnankfully our server was great.

Then when I got home I got a notice from Open Table that we hadn't kept our reservation. Not happy with Presidio Social Club.
author: Patricia H.

description: Great brunch food in a very cool setting.  The service was exceptional, as were the coctails and I'd definitely go back.  The fries were a favorite among all of us, as were the beignets.
author: Christina F.

description: Visited the Social Club for dinner. The ambiance of the restaurant is quite lovely and all the staff was very kind. The food I had however was not up to par to the price of each dish. I tried the mac and cheese, which was quite yummy however the burger for $15 (plus $2 cheese and $2.50 fries) was very mediocre. For a medium rare burger, I got a pretty rare inside through out the whole patty. The buns were so tough that I actually cut my upper gum biting into the burger It was SO dry - literally a bun, cheese (for $2 dollars), rare patty, and lettuce, one half pickle, and tomatoes on the side. It was one of those moments where I wish I had an in-and-out burger! The fries were nice and crispy. Best part of the meal.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
We visited for a late brunch in June with a large group and the wait staff was very accommodating. Great for groups, given the service and large, casually classy space. We started with brunch cocktails and a few brown sugar cinnamon rolls with cherry sauce to share - it is a must-order. 

The entree portions varied; I was happy with my Mission-style Chilaquiles, which were immense! Scrambled eggs and cotija cheese with bright and tangy tomatillo sauce, topped with half a sliced avocado. My husband had the Wild Mushroom Sugo with a Poached Farm Egg over polenta; it was a standard portion size so he polished it off and also had some of my Chilaquiles - both of which he rated as above average brunch choices. We didn't order the tempting unique brunch cocktails but the classic Bloody Mary was nice and spicy. 

Food: 4 Ambiance: 4 Service: 4
author: Vivian R.

description:
I am a big fan of PSC and it is my new fav brunch spot.  They food is really delicious classic American kind of stuff.

I recently attending their New Years Eve celebration and it was WONDERFUL.  The music, the food, the decoration,  We had the most wonderful time and I am so grateful to the amazing staff.

Thank you!
author: Amy P.

description: Tasty dishes.  We liked the eggplant fries.  Friendly staff tho dinner came a bit slowly.  Lovely outside deck where we ate with our kids.  They enjoyed brugwrs and mac n cheese.
author: Steve B.

description: Beautiful haunted building...  ate at bar. Food was good, atmosphere was blue-blooded upscale old skool. I hear the ballroom is haunted but didn't see any ghosts. Big lush green grass foeld right outside to run and play.
author: Judy K.

description: We showed up on a whim one evening to meet someone. Greeted cordially by the host. Waited for a few minutes for a table and proceeded to have a wonderful relaxed meal with good drinks and great service. Relaxed but classy atmosphere.
author: Gilder F.

description: The 4 of us went last night to celebrate two birthdays. The lemon drop martinis were yummy especially when the bartender uses fresh lemons but the martini glass is a little too small for me.  The dungeness crab fondue was very small. Kind of cheesy and creamy and a little runny and barely stayed on the flatbread cracker. The butter lettuce salad was nothing to write home about.  each couple ordered the oven roasted ribeye for two. It was a nice piece of meat. We both ordered it medium rare at the recommendation of the waiter.  When we received the steaks - it was more of a medium. And for $96 dollars I wished I ordered it rare. The truffle fries and carrots that came with the steak was excellent and cooked perfectly!!!  They had no ice cream sandwiches -  sad face!  So we had some lemon macaroons. Not too sweet or tart or lemony.
author: Donna L.

description: Visiting SF and friends reserved this charming location for dinner.  For those who may not know, the Presido is a former military base, now turned into public space.  The restaurant is housed in one of the (renovated) actual period buildings.  Stared off with Oysters, which were fresh and delicious.  The Tuesday Special was their house "Spice Fried Whole Chicken for two with Peanuts, Chiles and Scallions."  It came out with a wonderful thin and crispy skin and the spices and peanuts were a perfect blend to derive an amazing flavor.  The side of mashed potatoes was a perfect complement.  The Cenay Cabernet Sauvignon "Blue Tooth Vineyard" Napa, CA '14 selected by the hosts was rich and noteworthy. Dessert was Brioche Beignets and Chocolate Blackout Pie.  I had a 10-year old Port and the ladies said the "PSC 5 Ingredient Coffee was great with our sweets.  The only downside was the awkward wait when our dinner was put on the table, while our hosts, who had ordered the same dish, had to wait an additional 5 minutes for theirs.
author: Scott B.

description: This restaurant is underrated on Yelp. We ordered the rib eye and shared it for the whole family (4 people), it was 96 dollars and worth every penny. Honestly it was the best meat I have ever had. The meat was crispy on the outside and tender and juicy on the inside. Heavenly! It didn't feel super fancy which was great after a full day of tourism and not changing into a different outfit. Not to say it wasn't refined. The service was prompt and our server was attentive! The ambience was warm and cozy. Great restaurant, really glad I found it.
author: Nicole V.

description:
tldr: Good but not impressive. 
Went here for brunch, atmosphere was fantastic! No wait. Server was cool, above average. Menu was very limited, 12 dishes, we had the Chileaquiles, unique and good but not amazing, and huevos rotos, also good but not amazing. If you're going to have a limited menu, I just feel like all the dishes should be absolutely fantastic. Prices are ~$17-20 a dish and the portions are great, even a little big. Overall the food is worth the price, however, if you're looking for something to blow your pants off, this isn't the place.
author: Noah D.

description: We stopped here for lunch on our way to see Hamilton at the Orpheum (GREAT theatre). We have eaten here many times and always enjoy it.We think the one drawback is the limited menu. My meatloaf was terrific as was my wife's mac and cheese. Punctual and friendly service always. We love the "ambience" and nostalgia of the Presidio. It also doesn't seem to get the Tourists . The restaurant was very full and busy. PSC is one of our SF favorites.
author: Roger M.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to try out this place before seeing a show in San Francisco. It was incredible! The service was fast, the food amazing, and the ambience was perfect. 
We started out with two cocktails that were great. The bartenders wear lab coats, which was fun. We ordered the chicken, which we agreed was easily in the top ten best chicken I've ever had. The skin was crispy; it was so juicy and even the inside was bursting with flavor. The polenta and vegetables were so good as well. We also ordered a side of smashed peas which were good but not the best I've ever had. We ended with the beignets which were warm and light that ended the meal perfectly. Definitely a perfect place for a date night!
author: Davelyn C.

description: Love, love, love this place! Great neighborhood spot for brunch, dinner or even just cocktails (which are fantastic btw). Have tried most things on the menu and haven't been disappointed. Love their weekday specials. Great outdoor space for sunny days! Perfect for large groups and children. Service can be slow at times, FYI...
author: Mary D.

description:
(5/20/2017) Horrible service and mediocre food- We arrived and the hostess was on the phone for 4 minutes talking to someone and didn't even acknowledge us... Our waitress acted like she cared but she was a complete fake and a liar.  10 minutes to get 3 beers (it wasn't that busy)...
The food arrives and wasn't prepared according to the menu description.   We ask for the items that were part of the dish- She says ok... 15 minutes later she comes back and says they were out of it.  
If we had known we would have decided on another crappy dish.   No "sorry" or comping the dishes. 
Don't waste your time here when the City offers SO MUCH MORE.  
Pass it and move along!!!
author: James H.

description: Went there just before Thanksgiving 2017. Was very busy and had a good vibe to it. Lunch and wine selection both well above average. Wait staff very friendly.
author: Alan S.

description:
The. Worst. Host staff. EVER. 

We had a 12:30 reservation. When we arrived we asked if we could sit outside because it was a nice day. They said it would be a 15-20 min wait. 

We said we would grab a drink at the bar (which is quite visible from the host stand) and happily wait. 35 min later we asked about the status and were told 5 minutes. That host then disappeared. 

We asked at the stand ten minutes later and they unapologetically said they, "Couldn't find us." We were literally in front of them the entire time. 

She went to check on a table she thought was open. The other hostess unprofessionally said, "Hopefully not long, ladies. I'm just in training so it's not my fault." The table was not in fact open. The inquiring hostess said it would be "a few minutes more" so we left.
author: Jessica H.

description:
My boyfriend booked a large party for his birthday at 6pm and we were seated 30-45 mins past our reservation time.  The place had plenty of seating and the maitre d kept telling us that our table was being set up.  It wouldn't have been such a big deal but we had previously asked for a 6:30pm reservation time and thought it was ironic that we were delayed 30-45 mins anyway.  

Our party just grabbed seats at the bar and some drinks until our table was ready.  The server was superb! He was super accommodating and attentive.  The food, however, was not very good.  I don't really know where to begin.  Several of us ordered the bucatini carbonara and mac and cheese.  The same cheese sauce was definitely used for both dishes and it was not good in either dish.  The mac and cheese was utterly disappointing.  I had to take mine home and add some Parmesan cheese and truffle oil to make it edible.  There was only one note to it... almost like a cream sauce with no cheese flavor.  We also ordered the gruyere cheese toast w/ tomato fondue which you can barely taste the cheese on the toast.  I had the butter lettuce and it was again.. one dimensional.  It was one of the saddest salads I've ever had.  One of us ordered the oven roasted ribeye and it was decent.  The steak was tender and well cooked, but the best thing I think I had in this meal was the truffle fries...
author: Colleen L.

description: Love this place for Sunday brunch on the patio with a big group. Great food, service and ambiance.
author: Kelli N.

description:
Loud!
My first impression of this restaurant is that it's very loud. That's OK I guess. Lucky for us we sat in a separate room with only a few tables so it wasn't too bad.

Greeter.
They don't have a dedicated greater which I find always odd. And my uneducated opinion a restaurant of this size should always had of a dedicated person waiting for you to greet you when you walk in. Apparently the greeter here is also the person that suits you so, as with us, you may just have to wait and wonder what's going on. Unfortunately, none of the waiters that walked by I said hello or welcomed us to the restaurant. No big deal really it's just one of those things that I like.

Sticky table. The table was sticky. The table was perfectly clean it's just how old wood tables get sometimes they need to be sanded down and refinished. Again, not a really big deal just one of those things.

The burger is great. Very tasty high-quality meet on a wonderful bun. I'll get this again for sure.

Moscow mule in glass? I ordered a Moscow mule because it seems like the thing to get to wash down a great burger but it came in a glass and not a copper mug. Once again, not really the biggest of deals but, it's just one of those things that I like.

Ice cream sandwich is a must get. It's big, it's tasty and it shareable. You've got to try this thing it's really good.

Our server was great. Service here is on time and very friendly. That really matters to me. My water was always full.

Overall I think this is a 3 1/2 star experience. Nothing bad but there's 1 million great restaurants in the city.
author: Justin S.

description:
I had the PSC® Burger and I was surprised how such an overpriced burger could be so average. Wow!

The inside of this restaurant smells really bad. 

We sat outside and it was windy and cold. Maybe if they walled off the area next to the tennis court they wouldn't have menus and drinks flying off their tables.

Not for me.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Enjoyed the company of my nephew Robert and his lovely wife Leah here.
The ambiance was great. The wait staff excellent. The food, nothing to cheer about.
author: Paula S.

description: Very old school style restaurant with mediocre food and service. The servers hover over you while you eat and it's very clear that they want you to leave soon. Ironic considering that their food comes out super slowly. I ordered an arugula salad that took over 30 minutes to come out.
author: Shelley K.

description:
Large, beautiful venue in a gorgeous setting that's worth it for happy hour but not necessarily so at other times of day. The overall menu features standard American fare, but I'm not sure the portions and quality warrant such huge markups. Similarly, I found the cocktails to be just... meh. 

The restaurant probably benefits from its (relatively, for SF) remote setting. There's not as much competition near it as you'd expect elsewhere in the city, while at the same time there are new upscale offices nearby, not to mention the tony Pacific Heights neighborhood. Hence, they can get away charging so much for a rather average product.
author: Vincent L.

description:
We have been coming here since they opened many years ago and things remain average but at least they're consistent! 

Service is total hit or total miss. You really role the dice. I prefer sitting at the bar since that seems to be the best bet. But we came with a table of five last weekend for brunch and our server was a gem! 

Stick to basics with the food. Cocktails are well done and I love a bar that's open at 4pm. I have never had a grumpy bartender here, even during my visits in my 20's where I had questionable behavior. 

Parking is a huge plus for us but this would be a quick Uber ride from most parts of SF. 

They have a patio in the back if the weather is nice. We have used their large room for events and they seem to nail that experience. I won't dwell on the poor moments at this place because, hey, we come back!
author: Alison C.

description: Terrible service from the front of house! We have come here with our baby at least 10 times but today a very rude woman named Marjorie made us feel terrible about needing to bring our infant in a stroller. Our baby is too small to sit up in a highchair so we purposely choose big restaurants with lots of room to accommodate he stroller. I even made the reservation for 3 just in case they were very full. (Our stroller tucks into the table taking up the same amount of floor space as a chair.) When we got there (at 10 am to a mostly empty restaurant) the hostess (Marjorie) gave us a disdainful look and asked twice if we really needed the stroller in a very rude tone. When we said we did she sighed and told the waiter to seat us. Just as we approached our table she came running after us and said that she had changed her mind and, in fact, our stroller was too big and they couldn't seat us except in the back of some weird side room. We've sat at that exact table with our baby in a stroller countless times without issue. The whole thing was really poorly handled and made us feel terrible. Needless to say we left and won't be back. It's a shame because it was one of our favorite restaurants!! They would do well to find a new hostess who isn't completely rude to young families!!
author: Lily L.

description: People may talk about the service, ambiance, or beignets, but just let me tell you one thing. Don't get the kale salad. Costs as much or more than the rest of the menu, is bland as any salad I've ever had, and does absolutely nothing to fill you up. You will need an extra entree.
author: Andrew R.

description:
Happened to find this place when I was looking for a central place for Sunday brunch.  The restaurant is so cute and a good size.  I made reservations on OpenTable.  Seems to be a popular spot, perhaps also because of easy parking as well.  Our group of three plus one baby were all sat when we were all present.  My friend and I got the special veggie quiche of the day, and my sister in law got the eggs Benedict with ham.  

Prices are a little on the higher side for what you get but my quiche was nice and fluffy.  It wasn't overly rich and had a nice crunchy crust.  The salad was a mix of greens and lightly dressed.  I thought it could have been a bigger portion though for $15.  

I've seen mixed reviews on their dinner but I would be curious enough to come back to try some dinner appetizers or a main.  Service was fine.  The back room by the patio was very warm though will the rest of the restaurant was cooler.
author: Cat C.

description: So this place is cute. Came on a Saturday @ 12:15 for brunch with a party of 5. The Bloody Mary tasted like shrimp cocktail without the shrimp (they should ass a shrimp as garnish), shared the psc cubano sandwich, ahi tuna poke, and the beignets. The sandwich was delicious with the write amount of pork and ham. It could have used more pickles but the bread made up for it because it was so damn goooood! The ahi tune poke was simple and clean but you could tell it was really good quality tuna. The beignets which was really looking forward to fell flat, way to much dough involved and the exterior wasn't as crunchy as I would like. Not having powdered sugar around it made it a negative for me as well. Service was adequate but nothing out of this world. I would go back for drinks and apps.
author: Tamar B.

description: Hands down, one of best Halibut dishes (a special today). Great cocktails, service and location. Such a gem!
author: Samantha W.

description: Hosted a gathering here and white table clothes were not put down as requested and service wasn't great. Building and area was nice however.
author: Ravina Y.

description: Love this place. Classic SF vibe. Drinks are some of the best in the city. Oysters n apps were great too.
author: Jared T.

description:
I came for the first time on TUE for dinner. Great service, atmosphere, and food. I asked a salad, the soup and the truffle fries. The server asked if I wanted to start with the salad and bring the fries w/the soup. Excellent suggestion. 

I wanted to bring 2 friends on Saturday night. Upon sitting our service was very sweet. Our group hadn't seen each other in a while so we were busy chatting. She back very apologetic, no worries. I said, "I'd like to start with the salad; please bring my fries w/the soup. And I'm saving room for dessert, the lemon meringue cake specifically." She replied that particular dessert was fantastic. 

Our food comes out. Soup in front of me-no salad. Our server comes over and I remind her that I wanted to  'start w/the salad' and I'd prefer the soup and fries afterwards. My friend next to me wanted the salad first then the lamb meatballs- another mishap but she didn't bother sending the meatballs back. 

The fries come out cold and without cheese (they had shredded parmesan on TUE). I asked her about the cheese,  the server seemed confused and I wanted to get back to my friends' conversation. 

Dessert time, she takes our order we order 3 desserts and comes back with the bad news that the particular dessert I mentioned had earlier mentioned had run out. Hmm, any good server would have asked, "should I hold one aside for you?" Annoyed but the company was great. Not going back anytime soon. Sad, I loved my first visit and was looking forward to sharing the experience w/my friends.
author: Janine S.

description: The food is good, The ambiance and setting is great. The service however was terrible. PLEASE HIRED COMPETENT STAFF.
author: marc v.

description: Beautiful restaurant. Patio is fun too. Food is good but prices are high and small portions. Drinks are also $$.
author: Dee N.

description: Lovely brunch spot. Bright and airy and a change from the normal elbow-to-elbow SF brunch scene. Recommend going as close to opening as possible. We arrived at 10 and had good service and food came quickly. The quiche of the day was tasty and fresh.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
This place is a lot of fun for brunch. I would recommend arriving early and walking around the Presidio a little bit. Vibe on the inside is reminiscent of a army mess hall with some really cool urban updates. Service is really friendly and gave us good guidance on the unique items not to miss.

Don't miss:
Breakfast cocktails - Cafe Ferghetti
Brioche Beignets (w/ chocolate sauce)
PSC Gruyere Cheese Toasts
author: Tom B.

description:
We had the most wonderful cassoulet dinner at the Social Club.  It's casual but very comfortable.  We stayed at the Inn at the Presidio which was a very short drive.
Our server was Alex, and he was terrific - great service and a fun evening.  I'd highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Marie M.

description:
We came here for dinner. Location is wonderful. It was an extremely busy night. The
bar was hopping. The service was a bit off, but I found out that they were down one
person who was later replaced. Our server was doing his very best to make things nice. 
He was personable. The food was pretty good. Nothing fabulous, but quite good. Fresh
ingredients, wonderful flavors.
I will be back. Lovely ambiance.
I would recommend better staffing.
author: T. M.

description:
Firstly, I had high hopes for this place. I love the space and the cocktails were well crafted by talented bartenders, so I assumed the food would be great.

We started with the roasted baby artichokes which were not exactly roasted and came from a jar and were not fresh artichokes.

My wife had the burger and truffle fries which she enjoyed.

I ordered the braised lamb shank with quinoa. After a few bites of very bland food and hard not cooked quinoa, I sent it back very disappointed.

Hoping for a good finish with the desserts. My wife ordered the beignets and I tried the special molten chocolate. The beignets looks great, but were just so so served with room temperature watered down chocolate sauce. My molten cake was simply reheated cake and was also so so.

As I said I had high hopes, but I will certainly skip this place in the future.
author: Kevin M.

description: Great atmosphere and service that knows how to put teamwork to use. Beautiful interior with lovely views, delicious food, and a nice mix of people
author: Kelly R.

description: Service couldn't have been better. These people are on it. But not in an unctuous uncomfortable way. You can always tell the caliber of help when something goes wrong or you need something different. How do they accommodate? Beautifully. Wether changing a sauce or bringing out fresh rice puffs for the ahi app, they were happy to do so and efficient. The food is good. Not super inspired but good. The comfort plate of meatloaf with mashed potatoes was good although over salted. The salsa verde on the rockfish was bright and delicious. The fish flavor was excellent but it was a bit chewy underdone. The burger is stellar! The deviled eggs average and at $8 for 4 a bit underwhelming. Maybe some truffle salt or a sliver of pickled onion. Something. If you need a solid place that has a nice San Francisco feeling-the presidio grounds are lovely-and not hard to get a table at, go. I think a mimosa for brunch on that back patio would be terrific!
author: Peddie A.

description:
Great brunch; super fast food & service. They take reservations on OpenTable, but we walked in at 1:30 and were seated right away. Veggie bahn-mi  was delicious as was the mac & cheese. 
Patio is dog friendly too!
author: Anna S.

description: This outstanding SF gem was excellent in every way. The service was attentive and personalized, the food was prepared well and presented quickly and the historical ambiance was wonderful!  The chilequilles, soft cooked eggs, mimosas and begnettes were all outstanding.
author: Lauran H.

description:
Came here for brunch at 1pm on a Saturday and it was busy! We had a reservation, so got right in. I just went back to being vegan, and they had a few options including the Vietnamese sandwich, the kale salad and the fruit bowl. I had the sandwich and fruit. 

The sandwich came wth a side of greens. The sandwich was good! The avocado was very fresh. The fruit bowl was large and came with papaya. The cut fruit was a little overripe. The coffee was good, but the cups were on the smaller side and sometimes we had to flag someone down to refill them. I love the atmosphere here though and would definitely recommend coming here!
author: Tessa J.

description: The food here is good, not great, but the kitchen is appallingly slow. We had a dinner of sides, salads and appetizers so no main dishes that actually needed to be cooked, and it still took 2-1/2 hours. Would not advise going unless you have plenty of time to spare.
author: Gia C.

description:
I stopped by here with a friend for drinks. I am surprised by the mixed reviews. I thought the place is fab. We sat at the bar and ordered bubbly, which was good.  I then ordered oysters on the half shell, and they were really good. One point of detriment is when I asked about the oysters, the young man behind the counter admitted his ignorance about oysters, and claimed he can't eat them because he's allergic to shellfish so he doesn't know. Well, I'm sorry, that's no excuse: you should know your menu even if you don't like some items on it. I only asked about size and where they came from, any good server should know. No big deal, but the restaurant should do a better job at discussing the menu with all servers.

Otherwise, the food smells are divine, and I will be back for a full on dinner.
author: Massimo M.

description: The brunch is exceptional and the meatloaf, yes, the meatloaf is wonderful.  Fries good.  Deviled eggs good.  Bring your dog and sit out back.  Just come for brunch though and get the seasonal cinnamon roll. Full stop.
author: Eric H.

description: BBQ BUST! In the past we have frequented this restaurant and generally enjoyed the meals (lunch more than dinner). But the summer "barbecue on the patio" special we just tried last evening was a poor experience. This event was billed as fine and tasty Texas-style BBQ but it was anything but. All of the meet was overcooked and dry. The pulled pork had an OK sauce but the beef brisket was fatty and tasteless. And the chicken was the worst as it was overcooked and burnt and had an acidic taste that made my wife ill. The sweet corn muffin and potato salad was ok but the side coleslaw was harsh. The whole plate of food was overpriced at $45 and we could have gotten better BBQ from a street vendor at a much lower price. Hopefully they won't bring back this BBQ event as it seemed like a marketing effort to bring in customers.
author: Michael B.

description: Across the street from George Lucas' office buildings, so I suppose "Presidio" is an apt name. This upscale bistro makes for a very fine lunch, whether it's inside it's shiny and woodsy dining area or out on the warmly sealed patio (we like the patio). Of the dishes we had, I enjoyed the artisan meatloaf (it has an A-1 sauce taste without it actually being A-1; it's better) and the Cubano ham panini which is tasty to the point of stuffing your face. It's all very healthy for a lunch (or dinner), except for the fries. But those shoestring fries are just too irresistible. Most of the waiting staff wears white & black. #sublime
author: Sean C.

description:
I want to like this place better than I do. I keep trying because the location is great and the decor is very crisp, clean and welcoming. The food is meh, and the cocktails are often subpar for San Francisco standards though they are charging SF prices.  Come on guys, it's time to step up your game., you could have a really good thing here. 

If you want a basic meal and don't mind paying a bit more for the surrounding, go here.
author: Andrea S.

description:
This was our first time visiting the Presidio Social Club. By first glance, I knew it was going to be a good experience because of how many people were dining in that day. We arrived sometime in the afternoon, between 1-2PM. It was a 35-45 minute wait without a reservation. There are plenty of seating areas while you wait, inside and out on the front porch or you can wait with a cocktail in your hand at the full bar. 

Warning!!! Parking is limited and you need a parking permit so make sure to plan ahead. 

When we were finally seated, we were taken to the back patio which had a clear tent over the entire area to protect us from the rain. To start off our dining experience, we had the WARM BURRATA CHEESE PLATE $15.00 (grilled levain, melted Belgain endives), PSC GRUYERE CHEESE TOAST $8.00 (served with a tomato fondue dip), and TRUFFLE FRIES $8.50. For the main course, I couldn't decide so I got the KALE SALAD $12.50 (fall fruit, toasted seeds, sherry vinaigrette) and literally one of the best MACARONI & CHEESE $12.00 (topped with herbed bread crumbs).

It was such a lovely experience and I highly recommend you give a try if you're in the area.
author: Jason J.

description:
Amazing experience. 

Sat at the bar and had the truffled fries, meat loaf, drinks. Loved the ambiance here and the great service. Coffee was also great. All the juices in their cocktails are freshly squeezed. 

Particularly enjoyed the demi glace on their meat loaf dish which was of great aroma and clarity.  The mashed potatoes were nice and fluffy with a light character and balanced seasoning. The meat loaf was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. The carrots were rich in color and with a good crunch and complementing taste.

Our server/ bar tender was Sasha and she was entertaining and professional. Great cocktails! Ask for their cocktail of the week!

Thank you Presidio Social Club!
author: Martin H.

description:
This place has consistently good food and (with the exception of the hostesses) prompt, friendly service. 

The patio's great, but after a morning of hiking in the sun, a stool at the bar (with no wait) was perfect, too. 

The Vietnamese-style sandwich was delicious! Highly recommended.
author: Kim C.

description: I won't be back. It's not an awful place so I won't give it lower stars but- the smallest most basic deviled eggs ever served. Two eggs halved were $9.00. Drink was fine, sat at bar and service as so inattentive -- the bar tender and colleagues stood right in front of us, had a 5 min. discussion that we could hear every word of- and then proceeded to make my husband a lousy martini- they are hard to mess up, unless YOU DONT listen  to what they order. We were not made to feel welcome, we came in in work out tennis clothes since we just left the court- so maybe that was our mistake. We just wanted a quick bite and drink. No happy hour here. Atmosphere was a bit snooty. Not the place for a Maui-an.
author: Diane A.

description:
I am very sad that I have to give two stars because I was really exited and looking forward to go to this place! Ambiance is nice and comfortable but unfortunate since there was a long wait we chose their covered outdoor area which was nice but they need to keep it little more up to date with their table clothes, tables and chairs. 

The tent heather was on and made the area supper hot at the point that most guest were uncomfortable but again I am not complaining about that since it's hard to control the temperature to what makes everyone happy.

We went there for breakfast, it took for ever for someone to come and take our order, then for some strange reasons our food came out in less than 10 min which was surprisingly quick, but again  missing coffee and our side orders. our coffee came in middle of our breakfast and that's when I had to call and ask someone. we never got our sides. The food was too salty but there was no one their to complain to or ask to make changes. finally we got our server in the end of our meal asking us how everything was and when I told him we never got our sides or refill on our coffee, the respond was sorry about that , can I get you guys anything else or the check? wow ...we got out of their so quick that even the host was surprise seeing us leaving. Not a good experience with food but mostly with the awful service.
author: Elly M.

description:
Tucked away deep in the Presidio, this classic-looking social club felt very elegant and the space alone felt almost out of a different era. 

We started off the meal with bloodies, a staple of Saturday brunch, but these were almost too horseradishy making them more of a challenge to enjoy. The toppings were pretty run-of-the-mill, so don't expect anything fancy like cheese cubes or pepperoni. 

We split 2 entrees: the poached eggs and ham, and the tomatillos chilaquiles. 

The poached egg dish was my favorite, namely because of the accompanying sides: toasted sourdough, squash and sautéed mushrooms. The medley was delicious soaked in yolk and topped on bread. As much as I love potatoes, the baby squash bites were a nice change of pace from the same old breakfast spuds.

Chilaquiles in general are harder to perfect, and this dish alone was only 3/5 stars. The tomatillos were a nice addition, but in the end it I would have gone for a red salsa instead. The cotija cheese and avocado were the highlight of the dish, but the tortillas were past their prime and ended up more moist than anything else.

Although a little bit on the pricier side for brunch, you're paying for a classy spot with great service.
author: Rachel H.

description: Terrible service and highly overpriced food. Giving it 2 stars because the manager was helpful after we asked to see him. Note that the truffle fries are excellent. Other than that, a real disappointment, especially having been in many times before for dinner - I realized  after this truly sad lunch that during my dinner visits the good strong drinks were impairing my judgment all this time.
author: C. Marie W.

description:
Sunday Brunch.  Beautiful day.  Outside on the patio @ PSC.  

The fare:
Gruyere cheese toast w pork belly & truffle fries for me.  My companions ordered the PSC burger & the kale salad, respectively.

My dish won.  

My cheese toast w pork belly was nothing short of fabulous.  Juicy, flavorful, tender, & perfectly greasy.  It was straight up delectable.  The truffle fries were perfect.  Crisp & clean.

Sitting outside on the patio at the Presidio is no kick in the pants either.  But, if you sit inside, the space is elegantly modern & traditional, w large windows overlooking the presidio. It's a lovely space.

Desserts here straight up rock.  If there's a cake or pie on the menu, especially coconut or a merengue, get it.  Bliss.

Cocktails shine here, too.  But, I always have wine or prosecco, if not a Bellini.

PSC is always a great meal.  4 stars.
author: Veronica M.
