French manager was one of the most horrid restaurant managers i have ever experienced in my life. He lied to our faces, gave us attitude for no good reason at all, told off his servers in front of us, and didn't even have the decency to apologize for his behaviour. 

Ambience (3.5/5): 
The main dining room and bar is spectacular. Phenomenal interior. 
There an additional room built to the side. If you can, avoid a table there altogether. The acoustics in the room is painful and you'll end up with a headache.
author: Imran N.

description:
Came here with friends for my husband's birthday. We were there on a Wednesday and they were out of 2 of their main dishes, which is a little amateur for a restaurant that's been around so long. 
Dinner was good, but ordinary. The creativity and level of flavor has definitely fallen off.  We had the cheese toast and tomato fondue and lamb meatballs. Lamb was good, cheese toast was something you could do at home. Mains were all good, but again nothing special. Same goes for dessert. 
It's a great place to take someone that likes good plain food with no surprises. We won't be back though.
author: Chelsea F.

description:
It was a very nice atmosphere - the restaurant was near the baker beach (in the middle of presidio park). It was quite a nice scenery.

The food was good (it could have been better) , but it was really good for that place.  I was there for the brunch.

The service was little bit spotty. The waiter was very friendly at the beginning but ignored us for the rest of the brunch. We saw him do the same thing to all customers. This is a big no no no. I even had to stand up and get coffee myself two times!

I will definitely bring my friends on a nice sunny day ;-)  I am also tempted to come back for the dinner.

By the way, we were charged $27 for a burger, and I then looked at the menu. It was $15. I wanted to dispute that but my partner did not want me to do that so I had to let it go. But it bothered me a little bit.......
author: vadim m.

description:
We  just had a delicious, relaxed, and festive lunch. So many people out and having a fun time at a lovely time of year.
The ingredients in the food were fresh and tasty (mushroom soup and chicken and arugala salad with delicious dressings). The drinks were great. The greeter and waiter made us feel really special.  The desserts (mint chip semifreddo in a thin brownie with mint marshmallows and the cheesecake) were scrumptious.
And the setting is so lovely. Love the updated, old school feel.
author: Michele M.

description: Food was meh...  Prices were high.  I think we just really expected a little bit more.   The ambience was great and we'll give it a try for brunch, but that may be it..
author: Edgar C.

description: I've been here half a dozen times, the food is good, but the service is lacking.  They have a nice outdoor patio, which is great for brunch.  Just don't go here if you're in hurry!  Was just there and sat at the table for 10mins without being severed water or even having a server acknowledge that we were there.
author: Keshia H.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants. That being said, I'm giving my last visit a 2-star rating because of a variety of things. Our salads and appetizer came in a timely manner, but we waited an extraordinary length of time for our main dishes. I get it, the restaurant was busy that night, but with hungry children at our table, it was not pleasant. Our waitperson came over a few times to apologize for the long wait, but the kids don't care: they just want to eat. The second complaint I have is that I ordered the fregula with sausage and clams: three of the clams were not open which means you CAN'T eat them. I'm surprised the kitchen didn't check before they sent the dish out. Lastly, there was sand in the broth. The clams should have been cleaned more thoroughly.
author: Janice F.

description: Amazing experience! Great food and service. We ordered the gruyere toast, kale salad, and mushroom toast to start and the whole trout special, swordfish special, and bucatini pasta for our mains. For dessert we had the chocolate brownie, sweet potato cheesecake, and beignets. For drinks we got the French 75 and a bottle of the Sauvignon Blanc- both delicious. Our waitress was very nice and accommodating and the ambience of the restaurant was relaxed, comfortable, and pristine.
author: Alexa B.

description: Food remains delicious. Nice wine selection. Excellent service. A favorite spot for business lunches.
author: Phoebe W.

description:
Stopped in here for lunch while we were sightseeing at the Presidio and trying to catch a glimpse of the Golden Gate bridge through the fog.

Quite slow during the lunch hour, so indeed a great place to sit back, relax and enjoy a nice meal. We sat at the bar (that was our theme on this trip) and ordered:

(1) The mac and cheese
(2) A half dozen oysters
(3) Deviled eggs
(4) Chicken arugula salad

Everything was "good", but in a very bland way. Nothing was extremely inventive, nor did anything stand out tremendously. The bartender/waiter was also nice enough, but with an almost "I'm getting paid to put up with you" smug grin on his face.

PSC seems like an awesome place to grab brunch, or an excuse to dress up for a fancy dinner. We kind of struck out for lunch though.
author: Carol B.

description:
Negatives:
Very regimented rules: must have all parties before being seated, must order all courses at the same time AND a very long wait for our food (total meal took 3 hours)
While waiting for everyone in our party, we had to sit outside. Although the porch was pleasant enough, it was cold out there.
Most food was mediocre 
Overpriced for the quality of the food
Soda was flat
No bread came with the soup

Positives
Hostess was accommodating in finding a vase for our flowers
Beignets and the corn soup were both delicious
Good lighting during daylight hours
author: Melaina E.

description: Went for brunch on Sunday, gorgeous weather so we sat outside. Went with 5 friends, I ordered the Vietnamese style sandwich with chicken and the Gruyere cheese toast which I shared. Both were very tasty. Two of my friends ordered the huevos rotos which looked incredible and my friend stated that it's the best in the city, I am definitely getting that when I go back. We got the breakfast potatoes to share, they were golden and perfectly cooked. The rest of my friends got the kale salad with extras which they enjoyed. I will also come back to eat the burger, that looked amazing and juicy.
author: Liz S.

description:
Charming, but difficult to get to. The traffic in the area is horrendous and I developed an attitude just trying to make the reservation time.

That said, I thoroughly enjoyed it. Opted for the special, which was three baby back ribs on a bed of hash browns with an egg on top. Kiss my ass! And the Pain Killer cocktail was perfect. As was the service provided by Jenn.

Forgot to mention the fantastic patio and the brilliant direct sunshine. I mean, I didn't want to like it based on the intense traffic getting there, but I won't hesitate to return. But be warned. Open Table indicates ample parking, which ain't so!
author: Elizabeth Q.

description: This place has been excellent whenever I've tried it, including taking on short notice a party of over a dozen costumers when another venue was unreachable. And the visiting French family. And the elderly in-laws.  Down-home food and drink done right. One of my first recommendations for a special SF experience. And there's parking!
author: Dani L.

description:
I love the Presidio and PSC did a great job with the space.  I wanted to like it but failed.

The service is consistent, but it is consistently poor.  I ate at the bar in the early evening.  I had steak tartar or something bloody and nobody cleared my plate.  So I sat there staring at the bloody remnants.  I wanted another glass of wine but could not get anyone's attention.

So I wrote PSC off until a neighbor said i should give it a 2nd chance.  So I went for lunch and had the liver.  It was over cooked and dried out.  The bacon onion saute which should have been savory tasted like a sweetened compote.  The bartender, while bragging to a couple about what a great bartender he was, largely ignored me and the other solo diner.

It is a great space though.
author: Steve S.

description: It's great that you put a note on the door that you're closed for the 4th of July.    You know what would have been more helpful?!?!  Leaving that info on your voicemail or your website so that people don't drive across town to find out you're closed.  The difference between a great business and a mediocre one...it's in the details.
author: Deena B.

description: Had a great Sunday brunch here meeting up with family that lives in town. Food was great I had the eggs Benedict and my boyfriend tried the chilaquilles with pork belly on top! My only complaint is that there were a ton of kids running around while they're parents were enjoying a lovely brunch a well, so it got a bit noisy. But we walked here through the park and it was quite pretty. This whole area is historical and each building has a story. At first I was confused there was not a larger sign for this restaurant but then I realized its most likely to preserve the historical quality of the area and building. The service was impeccable and I also suggest getting the cinnamon sugar dough dipped into the hot chocolate as a little brunch appetizer. Perfect way to start a lazy Sunday, walk home to burn some calories!
author: Moe M.

description:
We love to stay at the Inn at the Presidio, and often dine in the area when we are there.  Everytime we would pass the Social Club, we would hear the buzz of happy campers filling the air.  We noticed that it is always open and usually full.  We made reservations for that evening, and were ushered to a table along the middle of the room.  It is the old Teen Club that served the Presidio when it was an Army base.  (One of the reasons we love to stay here, is my beau lived here when his Dad was stationed at the base in the Army)  We get a nostalgia vibe as well as admiring the beautiful militaryesque updates in all the buildings. 
We ordered a lemonade and a Cadillac Margarita, and I chose the Filet of Sole Special with roasted brussels sprouts.  The drink fortified me, and the festive, club-like atmosphere of the place relaxed me.  My pal got a perfectly cooked burger, with the most delicious truffle fries!  When the fish came, it was delicate, moist and delicious, baked in a casserole dish.  We skipped desert, but will soon return, since we earmarked this as a future fun return restaurant!
author: Saralee S.

description:
I've eaten here three times, most recently in late October 2016. It is near where my daughter lives, and the parking is easy. I very much like the old building and the atmosphere it creates.

Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this place. Here's why.

Loud. Others have mentioned this, but because of the extensive amount of glass coupled with hardwood ceilings, the noise gets very concentrated. It is virtually impossible to carry on a conversation.

Lousy service. This last dinner was the worst. It took fifteen minutes before we ordered, and there were other long 10-15 minute gaps in service. It was some of the slowest, least attentive dining experiences I've had in years. Really bad. This was true, to a lesser degree, during my previous two visits (both in the past eighteen months).

Average food. We had thirteen people in our group, and to one degree or another, each one had similar reactions all of which can be summed up as: meh. I had the swordfish special and it was a very average piece of fish, overcooked, served over some sort of sauerkraut. It was OK, but for the price ...

High prices. I paid the bill for all three meals I've had at this place, and on the first two occasions was blown away by how high-priced the final tab was. This time we had two children and, because of the lousy service, did not have appetizers or dessert (dinner still took two and a half hours!). As a result, it was $575 for thirteen people, which is not too bad for San Francisco. The last time I was there it was almost the same amount for six people, which is closer to what I think you will pay if you have 1-2 drinks, one appetizer, and dessert.

This is a place that, with the right management, some changes in the interior to make it quieter, and a decent chef, could be a really special place. I hope these changes get made some day.
author: John M.

description:
A classic San Francisco feel in quiet Presidio. PSC has the spirit of a bygone era with it's classy decor, air of sophistication, and superb service. 

The menu isn't broad, but features fewer distinct plates that have a character that you couldn't find at other restaurants. The chef's pasta special was a good choice. Their drink menu seems well refined with classic cocktails. I went with the Aged Reasons Rye. It tastes like a Manhattan with a hint of burnt orange. Fans of whisky will find a solid stock of rye here as well.

Service here is world class. JL was our server and provided service unlike anything I've had in SF. He was a playful, polite, articulate older gentleman that described each plate in the most minute detail. The style in which he took care of the table that of an experienced craftsman. Of all things, I think this is the most biggest hook for PSC. Not the food, but the feeling you get dining here is the capstone of the experience.
author: Gabe R.

description: I have mixed feelings about the place. Nothing special other than location? Easy parking and pretty place? Decent food but some  overpriced.
author: Ichi Y.

description: Really cool place and atmosphere. Awful service, everyone who worked there had a whole lot of attitude.
author: Stacy G.

description: Great place for brunch in SF! The service is good and in a perfect location for a post-brunch stroll in the presidio. Love it here - the beignets are delicious.
author: S H.

description:
I can't believe how long ago it was that we first came here! We've been back a few times since, so I figured it was time for an update.

We had dinner last night to get their Wed. roasted Crab special, and to celebrate V-day early.

Service wasn't great. 
It took a long time to get drinks,at the beginning of the meal when we ordered our first drink, and later on, when we ordered a second drink.
We had to ask for water refills more than once. I drink a lot of water, so this is a pet peeve of mine, (especially when there's enough people on the floor to keep waters refilled.)
We also had to request bread, and then remind the server since my hubby was waiting to finish his soup with it.

The food was good, with some things being better than others.
 
I had the Wednesday Night Crab Special, which came with half a roasted crab, butter lettuce salad, bucatini and a scoop of ice cream. The salad was literally a pile of lettuce with a vinaigrette mixed in. 
The crab and bucatini was delicious. I LOVE Dungeness crab, and the pasta was the perfect portion size, and I liked the spiciness of it. 
My husband had the burger and fries, which was outstanding. His burger was cooked perfectly, (which rarely happens) and his fries were awesome. I admit i stole a few. He also had a bowl of the soup of the day, and it was delicious.

Their version of a Moscow Mule was a bad one, bland, and not nearly gingery enough.
Although, I LOVED the pisco punch,and my husband did like his drinks.

We shared the pineapple upside down cake , which came with a wonderful toffee sauce. It was smaller than some of the other desserts we saw coming out, but the perfect size for us, (along with the ice cream.) I like when the portions aren't huge, so I can enjoy everything and not feel overly full.

All in all, the food here is pretty good, prices are mostly reasonable,but service needs work. It's a beautiful and historically interesting location, in a part of the city most people rarely come to.
author: Amanda G.

description: Good place for brunch with family. I wouldn't come here with girlfriends to toast mimosa after mimosa. Shared the Cheese Toast "Saigon Style" AKA a grilled cheese sandwich with pork belly. I didn't pick up on a lot of asian influence but didn't care, it was so good! So good, in fact, i went home and replicated it. I'd re-order this - it's thick crispy pork belly between cheese and two slices of grilled buttered white bread. Mmm carbs. I wasn't feeling 100% and had big dinner plans so i also shared the Chicken Noodle Soup. It was a basic chicken broth based soup with ginger, scallion plus a poached egg i added for a couple bucks. When given the option, i always add an egg.  Instead of dessert, we shared a cinnamon roll. It was delicious! Food was okay but in comparison to so many other great places in SF also serving up brunch, 3 stars.
author: Samantha L.

description:
The wife and I (and our ten-week old son who thankfully slept most of the time) had a memorable meal here last night. We started with deviled eggs and some Washington oysters, both of which were top-notch. The deviled eggs in particular had wife and I scratching our heads about what secret ingredient made these guys a step above the competition (and maybe even our moms' versions...Good thing they're not on Yelp!). 

The Cuban cocktail also paved the way for the coming mains quite nicely. The latter included a pork and pasta dish for the wife and liver and onions for yours truly. Both were outstanding, with the liver in particular hitting all the right notes in its seared perfection. 

Though pretty full, we nonetheless pressed on for dessert and were rewarded for our efforts. The ice cream sandwich with candied nuts and perfectly blackened marshmallows was off the charts delicious -- a rare upscale improvement on such a childhood classic. The beignets with a vanilla dipping sauce also impressed.

Lastly, our server was on point and the location in the heart of the Presidio couldn't be better. In terms of the interior area, lots of leather, wood and natural light. 

All-in-all, a rare five-star dining experience! Really surprised this spot doesn't have higher ratings. Definitely well worth a look for a special night out.
author: Matthew Z.

description:
An old converted bunker is the setting for this modern, sleek, yet homey restaurant. 

The Food: 

Fried Chicken Salad-- 
The fried chicken was perfectly crispy and moist, the salad was fresh and tasty, though I think a different lettuce mix, would up the class a little bit. 

Chicken Live Patte with Rye Toasts-- 
While the patte itself was quite good, I didn't quite get the relish sort of thing it came with. It didn't add much, if anything it made it less appealing. Also the rye toasts could have been nicer quality bread, toasted longer, and maybe buttered. As it stood, I was reminded a bit too much of rye wonder bread... I would have rather seen a little pot of sea salt and coarse ground pepper and crispy fresh baguette toasts to go with the patte. 

East/West Chicken Noodle Soup-- 
This soup is definitely on the tangy, lemon chicken side. I enjoyed the little star shaped pasta immensely! I do wish there had been a little more substance and less broth, but overall quite tasty. 

Service jumped up a notch when the server said that they would like to offer us a dessert on the house. SWEET! Must be that irresistible Susan charm at work again. 

Beingets with shot of Mexican Hot Cocoa-- 
This was the highlight of the meal. Hot, perfectly friend dough sprinkled with sugar. It was delectable dipped in the cocoa that was rich, with just the right creaminess and spice. NUMMY! 

Overall I think the price point is a little high. Improving the little details of the dishes would equate to a much more balanced experience. I think that they are trying to maintain a homey feeling to upscale dining but I think they should choose to actually hit the upscale quality or lower prices to a more home-meal type price point. 

Never the less I enjoyed my meal and would be interested in trying other dishes.
author: Susan C.

description:
Came here to meet up with some old friends that were visiting in town. Ambiance gets 4 stars, food gets 3. I love the location, located just inside the Presidio in an old army barrack. Great decorations and the inside has an old rustic feeling to it. Makes you feel warm and cozy inside. Service was about average, and the noise level is a bit loud but manageable. 

Food: 
I had the meatloaf and some of my girlfriend's hamburger and truffle fries. We also split an order of mac n cheese with the table. The meatloaf was a nice portion, but easily forgettable. It seemed a bit dry and lacked flavor. To be honest, I would equate this to the Cheesecake factory meatloaf. The hamburger, for the price did not cut it for me. Not when you have Roam and Umami less than a mile away. The truffle fries were definitely the best part of the meal for me. Crispy with Parmesan and that signature truffle taste. Mac n cheese was good, not excellent though. Just no wow factor for me. 

Dessert allowed Presidio Social Club redeem themselves a bit with beignets. these were absolutely delicious, large and pillow soft. 

Overall, this place is definitely worth checking out for the atmosphere. Kind of like Tavern on the Green, you don't really go for the food, you go for the atmosphere. It's a cool spot, if you are looking for a fun experience in the city.
author: Alex L.

description: Nice dinner on New Year's Eve. Mistakenly left wallet behind. Tall handsome gentleman with an accent found me in my car on the street half way up the block and gave it back to me. So nice! Thank you!
author: skip s.

description: Food was very good but small portions. However the service needs work. It took about 45 minutes for the entree to come after we ordered it and this was a Tuesday night.  The bar must have problems too. Some people at table got their drinks within about 20 minutes, others waited twice as long. I ordered a glass of wine and never received it. Though she asked me several more times if I wanted one but didn't really wait for an answer. Also she took the dessert order and walked away before going completely around the table.  Probably will not go back.
author: Nicole G.

description: Good food once you get it. Painfully slow service about which no server offered any updates. Lovely back porch setting, good burgers, located in the beautiful Presidio National Park, the perfect place for outdoor casual dining. Still, I would hesitate to suggest this restaurant to someone with truly hungry children in tow.
author: Lynn S.

description: The meatloaf is phenomenal, as well as the potatoes and carrots that come as a side.  The staff was also very nice.  Menu is overall small.
author: Christina S.

description:
I went to the Presidio Social Club with my family for brunch on Sunday. We didn't have reservations but got there right at 10 and had no problem getting a table. The beignets alone are worth the visit! 

Location:  This restaurant is located in the Presidio, one of my favorite places to escape the noise of city living. Parking is easy and accessible which makes this location a prime spot for weekend brunch goers. 

Food: The first thing we noticed was how poorly the brunch menu was organized. Seriously, don't look at the headers of the sections read each item. It was like someone just randomly placed each menu item on a piece of paper, shuffled them around, and was like "looks good enough." Anyways, once we had navigated through the menu we ordered the beignets. The beignets are INCREDIBLE! So much so, that we ordered a second round for the table. They are absolutely delicious and while writing this I am considering heading there now for the beignets. 

I also ordered the Mission-style chilaquiles (scrambled eggs, tomatillo, cotija cheese) which was too saucy in my opinion. The tastes blended together quickly and after about 5 bites I felt like I was just eating straight sauce and became uninterested in eating anymore. I would not order this again. I would however, order a third round of beignets and call that a solid meal. :)

Atmosphere: I loved the atmosphere here! It is a surprisingly large space and offers indoor dining, bar seating, and an outdoor patio (which I believe is pet-friendly). The restaurant decor is industrial chic and there are red accents throughout adding a nice pop of color. We all noticed and admired the neat light fixtures in the main room.

Service: The service was friendly and helped us navigate the poorly designed brunch menu. The food did take a long time to be served, but I think that was a kitchen issue not server related. 

Overall: I give this a low 4 overall. I would go back for the beignets without a doubt! I think this would be a great place for a group brunch crew (make reservations) and would enjoy trying something different on the menu as my main course.
author: 50 State By 30 T.

description:
I've wanted to eat at PSC again since first going here years ago right after I moved to the Bay Area.    Back then, during the heady Dotcom boom days, PSC was a wall-to-wall vortex of libations and great times. 

So when I heard that PSC was "working" a loop hole in the pathetic, completely asinine Foie Gras ban, it was a terrific excuse to gather some friends and head on over to sinfully indulge in one of my favorite and exquisite guilty pleasures. 

You see, there's something even more tempting about Foie now that it is illegal.   It's now the forbidden fruit, or should I say the forbidden offal. 

And I was hoping there would be protesters.....

I arrived a bit early to secure table.     They had Talisker on the drink menu.    Curses!  ...my favorite brand.    I guess this is not the week to stop drinking scotch.    At $15 a pop, it was the most expensive pour on the menu, but what the hell, life is once. 

Otra friend arrived, and we started with some apps....effective foreplay for the foie main event.    Smoked Almonds, Deviled Eggs; both delightful.   The eggs were petite and fresh, with just the right amount of mustard finish.   Very nice.     We also had the Gruyere Toast, which was a bit too spongy and puffy for my tastes, but the gruyere and slight mustard hints were just right.  

And then, dear readers, it was time.  

Apparently they took some of the recent negative Yelp reviews to heed (they last served it as a torchon on steak which received mixed and poor reviews).  This weekend they served the Foie (which is surreptitiously NOT on the menu ;) and seared with lingonberry reduction and brioche toast....my absolute FAVORITE presentation.   Were they reading my mind?     It was heavenly (albeit smallish), perfectly seared...just right.    I ordered twice.   Cut with a wonderful Guy Sabet Savignon Blanc, it had me walking on the clouds.

Then steak entree which was nice, but not mind-boggling.     Just good, meat and potatoes fare.  

For desert we had chocolate filled beignets which were outstanding.    I only had one (sugar in moderation); but they smashing - served with a white-chocolate sauce on the side which made it perfect.  

Presidio Social Club is a wonderfully converted Army Barracks, tastefully appointed with sleek furniture and FOH accoutrement that reflect 30's and 40's style which I love.    It feels like an Officer's Club gone retro in the 21st Century...a unique experience.  

Service was a tad on the slow side, hence the loss of a star, but not annoyingly so.  

Protesters be damned...I'll be back again soon to delight in my beloved (and now illegal) foie.
author: Max K.

description:
I have been here several times--most recently at others requests since the menu is too limited for me.  Parking is easy, though and it is central, so I agreed.  I will NEVER go back.  I love soup, and when I saw a chicken soup entree on a winter day (with asian flair) I was ecstatic.  What a disappointment.  They should be embarrassed to served a small bowl of what tastes/looks and seems like canned soup under the guise of 1)entree 2)asian 3 special!  Service was average at best.  They brought me cold coffee too...
Too many great options in SF to suffer this sad deterioration.
author: Rita G.

description: This is a wonderful place!  Busy, welcoming with excellent service.  The food was awesome including dessert!  Taylor our server was great!  Perfect for all kinds of groups.  We had dinner that included, swordfish, meatloaf, steak, pasta and dessert.  Appetizer was tasty!  Enjoyed by all!!
author: Michele C.

description:
Went here for a delicious dinner with my dad, BF, and sister the other night. I was thrilled with the swordfish and jasmine rice (one of the specials), and my boyfriend had the club steak plate, which was also fabulous -- I'm not a fan of blue cheese, but this was really good. For dessert, I had the salted caramel ice cream sandwich. Soooo good. Parking was easy, even on a Saturday night. 

Cons: VERY noisy, a little crowded feeling.
author: Alexandra N.

description: Just an overall underwhelming experience. We had a reservation for 7:30 and weren't leaving until 9:45. Mind you, we had one appetizer and two entrees. Entirely too long for what was supposed to be a quick dinner. Our server, Nicole, was nice but it felt like once she realized we weren't going to be drinking or ordering a ton of apps, pretty much forgot all about us. It took 30 minutes to get her attention again (after asking several people to get our server) to place our orders. Maybe it was an off night, it happens, as her entire section had the same "where did she go" looks on their faces.  It also appeared as if she had a bad cold. Note to management, if a team member is sniffling and coughing SEND THEM home! Poor girl, likely no wonder the service wasn't on point. We ordered the fries as a starter and the sole as our entrees. The fries came out and within minutes, so did the fish. No flow, no follow up, no one checked on us to see how the food was until we were completely finished. The food was, eh, decent I suppose. The fries were good but the fish was very bland and truthfully, tasteless. Really sad as I had high hopes! I work in the presidio and would gladly have recommended clients and friends had I had a better experience.
author: stephanie c.

description: Amazing from start the finish ! Good wine , apps , and a healthy assortment of entrees! The desserts are the best part ! I will go back time and time again.
author: Jessica S.

description: Me and my partner ate at the PSC on Thanksgiving and we had a reservation (at 4:00pm) for just the two of us.  Well, they sat us down finally after 50 minutes of waiting.  The manager decided who got a complimentary glass of champagne and who didn't as he passed cold & standing patrons on the porch with the welcoming bottles of bubbly; we got none!  I guess we didn't wait long enough? Just after 5pm we were seated.  Maybe because it was Thanksgiving (?) the food was cold and not very tasty.  There was no flatware on the table when the cold soup came out.  It took a minute or two to get a spoon. We had to send our food back a couple of times as they brought out the lukewarm side dishes.  Thank goodness they had a microware. I pushed my food aside when they rushed the under-baked pecan pie my way only to take a bite and declare defeat.   The bill came to $180 for that disappointment. It was the worst pre-fixed meal ever and  I was happy to go home and prepare a grilled cheese sandwich.
author: Annie G.

description:
Presidio Social Club was a total "disaster" yesterday afternoon. The restaurant had given us a reservation for 1.30PM (confirmed & time provided by them) on Saturday afternoon. We reached the restaurant at 1.35PM, and were told that they can longer seat us since the kitchen had already closed at "1.30PM" and they had reserved the restaurant for a private event. My friends and I had driven from the south bay and asked them why were we given a reservation at the same "exact" time the kitchen closes in the first place. The restaurant manager and the hostess got very defensive upon being questioned and started 'blaming' us for reaching 5 minutes late. 
Me thinks the restaurant had already turned enough tables for brunch, hit their quotas, the private event was even more lucrative, so why give a damn about few individual guests. Had the same feeling as being bumped off from a flight, even with a confirmed reservation. At least the airlines will book you an alternate travel. Here at the restaurant the attitude was completely unapologetic and complete disregard for us/customer.
author: Ninad S.

description:
What a disappointment. PSC has been on our list to try forever. We were treating another couple to dinner and were looking for a great night out. After ordering cocktails, appetizers and one of the more pricey wines on the menu, and side dishes, 3 meals were delivered but not my husbands.
We waited and waited, the rest of us just picking at our food in hopes of still having a warm meal. Finally he came to the table and looked perplexed when we asked him for my husbands dinner. He said he thought that the two men were going to SPLIT the prime rib! What? Two men SPLITTING a prime rib? He apologized. We reminded him that we were also still waiting for another cocktail to arrive. The wrong cocktail finally arrived and the prime rib about 10 minutes later. Okay, so this still could be a salvageable meal. We were optimistic - we ordered one dessert to split.  That is until the check came. They had included the wrong cocktail that came in addition to the correct drink and nothing had been comped - not even the single dessert. I mentioned the error of the extra cocktail to the waiter and told him that we were disappointed that my husbands meal (or a measly dessert) did not come comped. He said he'd ask the manager what they could do.......the revised bill came and they had deducted 
$ 17.60. $ 17.60. What did that represent? The prime rib was $45.00 for a small prime rib and a side of mashed peas. We all ate cold dinners (except, of course, my husband) So on a bill for $ 350.00 they give us a $17.60 comp?? Really??? Shame on them. My advice, order the hamburger and the meat loaf. Everything else is just ordinary. And pray for an attentive waiter.
author: L. M.

description: I've had excellent experiences every time I've been here. It's a fantastic brunch spot (check out their big list of hot boozy coffees), and they're great for dinner. Most recently, we had the beet salad, Gruyere cheese toasts and the Babette steak, all of which were delicious. The staff are also very friendly, and I really enjoy the atmosphere and the vibe.
author: Matt V.

description:
I've been here numerous times and today things were off. Just Murphy's law I guess!  First I ordered plain peach tea and got spiced ginger mint and I'm allergic to ginger, it almost an hour to get our food and it wasn't super busy and last the waiter was taking an order at the table next to us and when he reached in his pocket or bent over a half a cigarette flew on our table.  
It was almost as if it dropped down from above.  We all laughed and when we left promptly included it with the payment  Don't know if I'll make it a destination next time.  Really happy the cigarette wasn't still smokin. Haha
author: Cindy H.

description:
Oh my gosh! Love this place. Can't believe I'm just finally coming here. We had a great experience last night. Great, friendly service, yummy burgers and truffle fries, good wine and a great butter lettuce salad. Ambiance is also gorgeous. 

Only recommendation - get flavored aioli for truffle fries and burger bun was burned/hard on the bottom part. 

I'll be back for brunch ASAP!
author: Alexis T.

description:
Fantastic dishes await you. Started off the with the pork belly grilled cheese (YUM) and truffle parm fries. I ordered the special of the night which was mahi mahi with a spicy curry sauce and jasmine rice. It was simple yet done very well. Tasty! 

For dessert, we had the apple cheesecake and dirty dozen (beignets-ish filled w chocolate!). Again, simple but delicious. 

The space itself is inviting and beautiful and the service is great. (Great family friendly place too!)
author: Joy A.

description:
Excellent food; creative without being over the top. 
I would give it a $$$ for pricing.
I would have appreciated the waiter giving the price of the specials of the day; I hate to ask and many restaurants extent this courtesy to their patrons..
author: Donna W.

description: The menu leaves much to be desired, and the customer service was terrible. We'd called in advance to ask, before making the reservation, if we could bring in our own special dessert. The hostess said, "As long as it's not a cake, you're fine. Go ahead; it won't be a problem." When we got there, we were told that we would be charged $3/person for any dessert we brought. We asked to speak with the manager, who told us their practice is to charge $2/cupcake. Clearly, they don't have their requirements straight. I said that we'd asked in advance, and they said, too bad in an unfriendly, abrasive way. Go somewhere with a more varied, better menu and a customer-service-oriented staff.
author: Mitch B.

description:
What's that you said?  You've never what?  Oh, you've never been here... I could barely hear you above the din.  That pretty much sums up the symphony of cacophony in this place.  From 6 p.m. - 7:45 p.m. on a Thursday night it was packed and LOUD.  Apparently these old military buildings aren't much in the way of good acoustics and nothing appears to have been done to solve that problem when it came time to turn the place into a bar/restaurant.  

Above the clamor I enjoyed $1 oysters (Thursday nights, from 4 - 7 p.m.).  Perhaps this is why everyone is so loud and happy?  Served on a bed of crushed ice with a spicy mignonette, the small oysters went down with cool ease.  They were wonderful and finally at a price I can stomach.

I also enjoyed a perfectly delicious burger ($12) with good - but not world-class  - fries, and washed it all down with a chilly martini.  I liked this place, with it's great location just inside the Presidio gate, free and ample parking, and spirited crowd.  I may have experienced a bit of hearing loss, but I liked it.
author: Tracey A.

description:
This review is for my wedding that we had here about a month ago.  

Working with PSC was such a great experience.  Planning a wedding is stressful enough as it is, and working with a restaurant was great.  Their event planner, Gail, was wonderful, and was quick to answer emails and to get back to my husband and I on all of our questions and she was extremely detailed.  Working with a restaurant is wonderful because you don't have to work about outside catering, or getting tables/chairs/linens/etc.  We did have to order plates because their plates didn't match and some had red stripes on them.  But that was pretty much our biggest issue with this PSC.  They took care of ordering everything and Gail simply gave me options of what type of plates I wanted and she took care of the rest.

We also had three specialty cocktails made for our reception, an aviation, a manhattan, and a twist on a french 75 and they were fantastic.  Our guests enjoyed them (some enjoyed them a little too much, but hey, it's a wedding right?!).  The food was wonderful, we had prime rib and chicken, along with a great kale salad (if this is on their normal menu, you should definitely order it... what san francisco girl doesn't love a good kale salad?) and the gruyere grilled cheese for appetizers.  For desert we had fleur de sel cookies and beignets filled with chocolate.  Every step of the way Gail and the rest of the team at PSC worked to create what we wanted for our event... something that was classy, but a little whimsical and fun.  We even had french fry cones brought out for our guests towards the end of the night.  

It was a wonderful experience, and we wouldn't have changed a single thing about our wedding.  If you are thinking about using this restaurant as a reception venue, or for any sort of party, I completely recommend it!
author: Brooke S.

description:
Had brunch on their beautiful outdoor patio on a perfectly sunny and balmy morning.
My friend had chilaquiles, I had the croque madame, and we shared an "everything" scone. Coffee was perfect, with timely refills.  There were several intriguing items on the menu that I'd like to try next time.
Waiter was friendly, knew the menu, offered good advice. Didn't feel rushed: felt comfortable lingering over coffee.
Hostess a tad chilly; she took us to indoor seating and my friend asked if we could check the outdoor seats.  Instead of being gracious and taking us outside, she seemed put out.  Maybe woke up on the wrong side.
author: Liana T.

description:
I'm gonna be honest with you - we mostly ate the mac n cheese.

I had dinner at PSC last night for a friend's birthday. I have always admired the restaurant from afar, but this was my fist time inside. Equally as adorable on the inside as out.

We started our meal with the butternut squash and burratta appetizer (yum), and an order of truffle fries. Could not determine what the second dipping situation for the fries was ("I mean, it wouldn't be JUST mayo." "Maybe it's an aoli?" "Do you think it's ranch?" "Isn't aoli basically just fancy mayo?"), but regardless, all was delicious.

Of the six of us, 5 ordered the mac n cheese since we decided we would be too jealous of the others. #6 got the tuna poke. Everyone was pleased and pleasantly full.

I had picked up some cupcakes earlier in the day for us to have as a dessert. Note that there is a $2 per person fee for desserts if you bring in your own. i haven't done a cost analysis, but I feel like it was probably worth it since we ended up with cupcakes.

I hear that PSC has an excellent brunch, too, so I will be back to try that. And for dinner again, when someone else is paying.
author: Nora S.

description: I really enjoy the PSC. It is a beautiful restaurant. The service was a tad slow, but the food was very good. The high lights of my last meal were the Tuna Tartare and the chicken. It was exceptional and very filling. Not the lightest food but it is definitely worth going there to treat yourself and your dining partners to a good meal. I'd think to come back here and sit/eat at the bar...very mellow setting.
author: Derek S.

description:
I really wanted to love PSC, I really did.  The location is amazing, the décor is beautiful and stylish and the menu is creative.  What was wrong you ask, basically the service.  The waiter was nice, but was not able to answer basic questions about the menu and ingredients.  Once we did order the food took forever, and we were basically ignored once we received our food, no drink refills, or questions about the food.

Did we just get a new waiter, or maybe someone just off their game?  Perhaps.  I really want to love PSC, maybe I will give it another try...
author: Cat G.

description:
I am completely astounded by the service we just received. We went here for a work event and spent several thousand dollars on the back patio and was welcomed by the rudest service I have ever experienced. 

In fact, on my way out, I walked through the restaurant (from the patio, the only way you can get from outside to the front door) and the wait staff was having a meeting. They stopped mid sentence as I walked through, all stared at me, and the person leading the meeting looked at me and shook her head like I had done something wrong. 

By the way, I had my engagement party here too with my family last month and also spent a great deal of money. What are you shaking your head at?? How do you have the right to be rude when we have been nothing but kind. 

I am never coming back and never recommending it again.
author: Maggie P.

description: I've been places that make worse drinks and have a less inspired cocktail menu but this place is pretty convenient.
author: David M.

description:
My first time eating here, and I will definitely be back.

I ordered the ham and poached eggs - very nice presentation, the eggs were delicious, and the ham was succulent.  Another diner at my table ordered was the Chiliquillas. The chiliquillas (maybe the spelling is wrong) were too many tortilla chips, and they were soggy. She couldn't finish it, and ordered a side of pork belly after - which I sampled and it was excellent.  

The service was outstanding!  Extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating staff. 

I highly suggest giving the restaurant a try. Nice setting in the Presidio.
author: Jiro W.

description: What a nice surprise- last time we were here it wasn't that good so am happy to  report we had a wonderful meal tonight. Great service, delicious food. Thank you for a very good Easter.
author: Pat K.

description:
The charm and ambiance of PSC is incomparable, beautiful location in walking distance to the Golden Gate Bridge, Crissy Field, Walt Disney Museum, and everything else the Presidio has to offer. 

We dined here on a Sunday around 1 PM and we were extremely annoyed to find that they only serve breakfast/brunch on weekends....I wonder why that is? My boyfriend is not a breakfast/brunch food fan, and the fact they only offer the breakfast/brunch menu all day left him with basically only one entree option to choose from, which was the PSC Burger. Minus one star.

The service as alright...we were seated quickly but it took our waiter a very long time to bring us menus, water, and introduce himself to us. We were actually about to go up to the front desk and ask for some menus, water, and oh yeah - service. Our waiter ended up being a nice guy and the food came out within a reasonable amount of time though. Minus one star.

We had: 

PSC Burger with fries - it was honestly an ok burger. We have definitely had better burgers elsewhere (Umami and Gourmet Burger Kitchen come to mind). It was awfully small for the price, and not very flavorful. The bun was a miss. Fries were good though, as were the pickled onions that were served with the burger. Would not order again. 

Baked Mac n Cheese - OMG cheese! This was actually, in all honesty, one the top 3 Mac n Cheese meals that I've ever had. The cheese sauce was the PERFECT consistency, full of flavor. 5 stars!! Would come back to PSC just for this. 

Pork Belly - very good! A tad tougher than I like my pork belly...but still delicious. Fatty, salty, and full of flavor, the pork belly was excellent with the mac n cheese. 

Oysters on the half - I mean how can you go wrong with oysters on the half? Well, I guess you can...but these were great! Served with mignonette sauce.
author: Paige M.

description:
Brunch was delicious.  The food was good but the drinks were great.  The shining star of the meal was definitely the the French 75.  

We sat on the patio and our server was so friendly and enjoyable.  The patio is a great spot to bring a dog as well.

Overall great experience and I will be back.
author: Hannah R.

description:
I preface this by saying we have been here many times and hosted and attended events (birthdays, weddings, brunch etc) and were always happy with the food, service and the restaurant.  My sister was visiting from Italy and I thought this would be a great place to stop. Last week we stopped in about 4:30 pm, were seated and given the bar and drink menus. We order Apenzel Spritzes. I asked our waiter, who seemed very preoccupied, when the dinner menu would be available to which he said about an hour or so. Ok.  About 10 minutes later, a family was seated near us and I noticed they were given dinner menus. We would have gladly waited 10 minutes. We had not yet ordered but thought we would not say anything.  In the meantime, a bus boy was sweeping on the other side of our area raising dust. He then comes next to our table and begins sweeping raising a lot of dust and I asked him if he could please not do that now. My sister was sneezing. He walked away without saying a word. If they needed to clean this area, they should have seated us in another area. 

We ordered and my sister ordered a big salad and asked if she could have some bread with her meal. The food came and we again asked our waiter who seemed bothered by the fact that he was dealing with us about the bread. He went to the kitchen and came back and said that there was no bread available right now, as they were baking the bread for dinner. I asked him how long and he said about 10 minutes. OK fine.  About 45 minutes later, a young women came over and asked if everything was ok. I asked about the bread, she went to the kitchen and returned with a basket of bread. It was not warm, so I knew it was not freshly baked for dinner. This server could not have been nicer or more attentive, so I have only praise for her.  

I assume the other waiter had finished his shift. If he did not want to serve us, he should have told his supervisor that he was ending his shift and would prefer not to take a table. I probably should have asked to speak with the manager, but was stunned about the lack of service. The food was fine, but with service so lacking I cannot give this experience more than 2 stars.
author: Celine S.

description: Stopped in for a drink before going to Palace Games. There was a group of 8 of us and we got there around 5 and sat at the bar. The staff was friendly and the food came out pretty quick. We order the Brussels sprouts, grilled cheese, and French fries. All three were good but nothing life changing. I liked the garlic mayo that came with the fries and the grilled cheese came with a tiny side of tomato soup for dipping which was nice. Overall if I was in the neighborhood I would stop by again. It might be nice if they tried a tad more innovative menu. I'm so tired of Brussels sprouts and fries, we actually went to two other bars that night and they all served Brussels sprouts, deviled eggs and French fries.
author: Michele H.

description:
I like this place. Had lunch here earlier today and looking forward to many more. 
Food is somewhat ok, nothing to rave about. Decent Croquet Madam but I had better.
Drinks are solid. I think PSC is famous for it's fizzy drinks so opt for Mimosa or Bellini. There is also separate menu of hot drinks and they all looked good to me too- who doesn't like Irish Coffee?! 
I also enjoyed flourless chocolate cake and strong and foamy latte. 
Bunch of fruit flies were fluttering around attracted by all the sugar I was feeding on:) Unavoidable since we sat outside. 
What I like about PSC is it' particular ambiance. Indescribable momentum of an old school charm. You just feel all sorts sentimental and nostalgic when you there. 
Service was very pleasant and not intrusive- just the way i prefer it.
author: Liza B.

description:
My sister-in-law frequents this place, and swears by the Kale salad. She brought me here last night, and everything was pretty great. We decided to go casual and sit at the bar- you know, and put out the vibe. Just kidding. We started with the kale salad (delish!) and the heirloom tomato salad with the add-on burrata ($6). Seriously, why is that even an option? You shouldn't have a choice. GET THE BURRATA. OR ELSE. The tomatoes were amazing, though, too and I don't even like tomatoes. We then both went with the "Daily Catch" which was Sole in some type of cream sauce with capers, layered on top of green beans. It was also pretty good. It was dry, but of course I ate the whole thing, so how bad could it have really been? 

Overall, I found this place to be pretty adorable and the food was solid. Oh, and to the scumbag that thinks it's ok to leave your dog tied to the sign outside without any water for 2 hours (or longer?) I hope something really bad happens to you.
author: Ashley C.

description: I've been to this place probably 10 times over the course of 3 years. I've been there for every meal - breakfast, lunch and dinner. The decor, style and location are really the only good thing about it. I want to like this place and I think by now I've given it enough chances. The combination of poor service and just-ok food, which hasn't changed over the past 3 years, leaves me with the feeling that the restaurant is continent with what it is and doesn't have any plans to improve.
author: Alex C.

description:
As I walked up to the entry to the Presidio Social Club (PSC), I felt something was different about the framing of this building and I told myself maybe... a barracks.  It was only when I read a plaque describing the historic 1903 building that was indeed a barracks converted into a modern eatery.

PSC is a restaurant you can dine with friends, have a glass of wine and small hors d'oeuvres.  Please do try the PSC gruyere cheese toasts with tomato fondue for Hors D'oeuvres.  Melts in your mouth!

Market Vegetable Salad with walnut vinaigrette and pecorino cheese was very fresh and surprisingly filling after all the hors d'oeuvres.

A side of fries are a must!  It was just the right amount of crisp and salt! Love it!
author: Nell C.

description: I came here for a graduation celebration and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. Although a little dark, the food wasn't bad and the service as absolutely amazing. I had a really good starter, this tomato fondue with burrata cheese with bread for dipping! The taste was amazing and the cheese was melted beautifully. The pork chop I ordered for my main course was a lot thicker than I had expected. The meat was a little rough and a bit hard to chew but other than that the taste was amazing. The best part of the pork chop was the grilled peach that was placed on top. Overall amazing experience, definitely coming back for a second experience.
author: Sharon L.

description:
Awful Food.  

Eggs Benedict with greens was served on soggy toast with runny egg whites and Kale??  I sent it back only to order Tortilla soup  (Mission Style Chilaquiles). The eggs where scrambled like pieces of foam and I couldn't for the life of me taste any cheese whatsoever.  My eight year old son simply ordered the Mac & Cheese.  It was bland and colorless.  Adding salt mildly helped.  I tried to mask the bad food with alcohol only to receive a small Bloody Mary that was SO spicy I could only drink half of it before it became mushy and riddled with too much pepper.  Vodka? Maybe a 1oz pour.  Lastly I asked for a Chardonnay ....any Chard...He came back with a 4oz. pour of something mildly pleasing for $13.00.

Our server was very accommodating and pleasant.  It WAS a very busy Sunday brunch.  Perhaps it was an off day Presidio Social Club.  I would only go back for drinks and location....
author: Melanie K.

description: One of my favorite things about the interior of this space is the awesome long bar. You're transported into San Francisco's Presidio with the throw-back style, but you get all the amenities and amazing food, service, and experience for today's expectations, and they will surely be met! Gruyere toast and tomato soup is a classic and is always good. They cook fish excellent, and serve what is fresh. You can't go wrong with steak either, and their wine list will pair nicely with your protein. Always a great place for a cocktail- you can get as pretentious or simple as you like; and that's one of the things I like most about this place.
author: Kara W.

description: We spent an amazing New Years 2016 here. I gave it 5 stars for many reasons, first, there was no set menu for NYE, in my book, that's a HUGE plus, with kids who wants a fancy set menu?  The location is awesome, we walked from Cow Hollow and it's right inside the Presidio. When we arrived, we were greeted by the nice hostess and seated right away, no waiting at all. There was a fun jazz band and it was VERY kid friendly (aka loud!), no one noticed our kids at all, even with all their fussing. The wine list was great, we ordered a good bottle of Napa Cabernet and our meal was delicious. We ordered deviled eggs with caviar, steak and Brussel sprouts. All in all, excellent atmosphere, people dancing, good drinks and awesome meal. A night to remember!
author: Jenny S.

description:
We have been here before and generally like it.  The food was good but the rest of the experience was questionable.

We had a 9 pm reservation on a Saturday evening.  At 8:50 I called and said we would be 10-15 minutes late.  The hostess said "no problem". We arrived at 9:15. 

They asked us to wait a few minutes at the bar.  About 10 minutes later they told us that due to our tardiness it would be a long wait.  At which time I said that I'd called and was told that being a bit late was no problem.  If it was we would have  understood and would have made other plans.  I said that now that we were here, we would like a table within a reasonable period.  Mysteriously a table appeared.

We sat down, and with 10 minutes the waitress appeared and told us that the kitchen was closing in 5 minutes and we needed to put in our order.  To me this is completely unacceptable.  Keep in mind that it was ONLY about 9:30-9:40 on a Saturday night, and about 15 minutes later they seated another party (I thought the kitchen was closing?)

This is no way to run a restaurant.  It will be a while before we go back.  


PS. At the end of our meal about 60 minutes later, the hostess staff sat down with a full meal in the dining room with patrons.  I thought the kitchen was closed?
author: Gary H.

description: Great place and casual vibe in old military social quarters hence the name Presido Social Club. Had the Brevette steak with Mac n Cheese. Awesome! Get the Mac n cheese which u can have as a meal itself!!  Will be back next time in SF!!
author: Doug M.

description:
A Valentine's Day lunch started with a wait on the porch while the staff finished its staff meeting and tasting of the day's menu before opening the restaurant ten minutes late.  Inexcusable.  

Despite it being a Friday and one of the busiest restaurant days of the year, the restaurant was only 1/3 full when we left at 11:30, not a strong endorsement of this place's apparently declining reputation.  Service was prompt and courteous and the food was hot and tasty, although predictably over-priced.

As was reported in several other reviews, my wife and I both experienced stomach upset several hours after eating...was it our meal?  We think so.

We would not go back, despite the other appeals of this restaurant.
author: Bob P.

description:
I was excited to finally go to brunch at the Presidio Social Club and even more so to have an awesome table outside on such a beautiful day. The excitement ends there though...  we had a table of five and were each expecting to get quite a few drinks. We didn't get a drink for 35 minutes (huge lost tip and $ opportunity for the waitress and the restaurant)

Our food came about an hour after we got there. We each only had the opportunity for one drink since the waitress never came back. Funny side story we caught the waitress pouring water into glasses at a table where nobody was sitting anymore to try and look busy...very funny/crazy to see.  I'm hoping this lady was just new...

Bottom line was we had very very poor service and the food was aggressively mediocre and it seemed much more expensive than other places we go in the Marina. My bill was $38 for my bloody Mary, croque madame and fruit.. wouldn't suggest this place until they make some serious staff and menu changes.
author: Scott H.

description: Great all around. The space is historic and warm, the staff was great, and the food it best of all. this is a great place for a long relaxed dinner.
author: Gilad B.

description: Overpriced. Underwhelmed. Skirt steak was unchewably nasty. To be honest I ordered the dish because of the "Duck fat fries", you don't pass that up, right? Well, the two of us who ordered this dish sat waiting for 10 minutes for our fries to show up after the skirt steak arrived.  After notifying the waiter, we were informed the the duck fat "fries" were actually the four miniscule oven roasted half fingerlings hidden under the skirt steak. Uh, FAIL? The buttered turnips completed the mess. Turnips should never, ever, under any circumstance, be undercooked and hard. Ew.
author: Anthony B.

description:
I have been to the Presidio Social Club many times and have never had a bad experience. In fact, it is one of my go-to places and my parents always request it when they visit me. We've always had excellent service and excellent food. What makes the place really special though is the building. Converted from an old military facility, as many of the buildings in the Presidio have been, it is a charming mix of old-fashioned and chic. (Example: Old metal cabinets converted into bar storage, bartenders in white coats, yet elegant and modern decor.) Everything I've ordered has been good, but special favorites are the cocktails, the kale salad, the tuna poke, and the desserts. They also have a killer meatloaf that my dad gets every time. 

I was a little distressed when I saw that PSC was getting some not-so-stellar reviews lately. Having not been there for 9 months or so, I decided to go back last week when my dad was in town. Again, we had a lovely experience, so I thought it was time to chime in in favor of PSC. 

This place has style, charm, and great food!
author: Haley W.

description:
It's hard to find this 3.5 star gem. 

Good thing we came here during the day. Had a 4:30pm reservation on the wknd Foie gras was being re-served in SF. Love this country club. The hostess were nice n sat us immediately in the semi private room. 
Luv the decor, felt like I was brought back in time when everyone dresses up for dinning. Our server was funny which made the ordering "fun". We ordered devil eggs(ummmmmm perfect), the corn purée SOTD was warm n buttery, olives, pâté plate of heaven, the tuna poke. All were delicious. 

For entree we had the MP steak for two which came with a bottle of wine, fries and creme puff. Umm, the steak was just ok...not filet mignon quality at all, tho it looked rare, it was rather dry and chewy.  Had we known it was $98 we probably would have ordered different.ly Also, we had the mussels and meatloaf. Not bad, not bad indeed. 

The main reason why I chose this place was "Foie gras" of course. I wasn't lucky enough to eat much before the ban so when I heard on the news the Social Club will be serving it this past wknd, I jumped at the chance. It was $18 per person. We all enjoyed it. Was it the best...no but it was good enough. It was rather bland, missing some homemade jam n bread. 

Again, it was good enough. Next time I will be back for their brunch menu
author: Vee V.

description: Love the food, the bar, the vibe. Tonight had the worst service ever. Was lucky to get seated without a reservation, but then waited 20 minutes before anyone asked us for a drink order. Another 10 minutes before someone showed up with water, another 20 minutes before we ordered food, then 15 minutes waiting for food, 20 minutes waiting for the check...you get the idea. When the waitress showed up with our check, she did a yoga pose and thanked us for our patience. $90+ dinner for two. I asked to speak to the manager, told him how much I've loved the restaurant, I've been multiple times, but got the worst service ever tonight. No real apology, a general - yeah we are trying to get better - kind of response. WTF?
author: E G.

description:
I came here on a busy Saturday afternoon.  The place was crowded and there was a long wait to be seated. Thankfully there were two seats available at the bar area. My gal pal and I sat down for some drinks and an appetizer. We had the tuna poki which was served with crunchy chips. The glasses of wine the were recommended to us by our server were exactly what we were looking for. 

I love the atmosphere of this place. It's has a casual setting with good quality food and awesome service. I'll definitely be coming back to try some things on their brunch menu!
author: Tracy C.

description: I had brunch here with family. Don't expect them to seat you if arrive early. Just arrive on time or you'll be waiting. We're finally seated on-time and the waiter takes our order. I ordered a homemade strawberry lemonade which I thought tasted just right. Not too sweet or rich. My main ordered was the PSC Burger (cooked medium rare with blue cheese and bacon). That along with the slightly seasoned fries with a garlic taste filled me up good for the rest of the day.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
This has to be one of the hidden gems of the SF brunch scene (and anybody who has seen the lines outside Zazie or Plow know what I mean). The location is pretty spectacular and has the feel of a country club. 

We had reservations for a very large group but when we showed up at 11:45 the place was not particularly crowded. I ordered a veggie sandwich with chicken on it (aka a Chicken sandwich). Man, was the chicken juicy or what. And the lady got the chilaquiles which were also very flavorful. I could have almost had one more plate of each. The best part is that they were super patient with a very fluid large group that we had going on. 

If I have friends in town and want to try a SF brunch, this spot is definitely at the top of my list.
author: Rahul H.

description:
Ive been here like 5 -6 times and love it!  The mixed drinks are great but just having a glass from their great lists is well worth it
1
author: Kevin F.

description:
Great food, comfy atmosphere, date-night lighting, and courteous waitstaff.
Loved it and have already been back again.
author: Mitch L.

description:
Presidio Social Club would seem to have it all.  By that I mean a prime location in the Presidio and hard by the Marina.   But no matter how good your location and how good your chef may be service still counts.  A lot.

After being seated this evening I waited.  And waited.  And waited.  Finally, my waiter rushed by giving me a quick nod.  He seemed stressed.  Rushed. Distracted.  Despite not having many tables to tend.  After some time he asked for my order.  I asked for the specials of the evening.  He went and got a card with these and plopped it before me.   I asked the pricing of the shrimp cocktail.  Off he went to find out.  Upon being told I asked the pricing of the halibut.  Off he went.   Well, you get the picture he knew nothing of his business.  He never did tell me about the roast of the evening (which I would have ordered had I known of it).  

I told him my desires and he repeated my order incorrectly.  I repeated my order and he again repeated it incorrectly.  After a third try he got it right.  But what came from the kitchen was not.  He got it wrong on entering it in the computer.  

Now, don't get me wrong.  My server was trying.  But he was obviously beyond his depth and training.  At least tonight.  

All of which is too bad, as the kale salad was nice, the halibut better than that and the roasted vegetables (carrots and cauliflower) were better still.  

But what could have been a lovely meal was a stressed out mess.
author: David D.

description:
Came here one Sunday morning for a brunch.

Beautiful Day. Beautiful Setting. They have a small outdoor courtyard that would be really nice on a beautiful day.

Service was prompt and friendly.

Food was pretty good - pricey for what you get - but not outrageous.

I got a pork dish and pork belly piece was really really small.  It was a pork medley (pork belly, bacon and some other pork).  While it was good, it did feel pretty greasy half way through my meal.

One of our friends was really in the mood for french toast so ordered 
rum soaked challah french toast bananas, maple syrup on their breakfast menu.  While it sounded good (challah, french toast, maple syrup!!!) rum was over powering and none of us on the table enjoyed the dish.

I would probably return for the atmosphere (I feel ilke it could be a good place for drinks on a nice sunny afternoon as well) - but not so much for the food.   None of us drank that brunch so I don't know what their drink prices are like though..
author: Sujan H.

description: Food was great; service not so much. Get the bloody mary and the chilaquiles! Don't get our waitress :/
author: Cat L.

description:
What happened to this place? It used to be delicious.

The menu was limited and I was hoping this was a sign that the few dishes they had, they did well.

I avoid pork, so that cut the weekday special, and the chop of the day out for me. I could do the steak but didn't want to spend $32 on what I was afraid would be a sub-par steak.

I went with the chicken. I was unimpressed. I've had better chicken from the rotisserie at Safeway. 

My boyfriend had weekday special, the pork and found it bland. 

The only thing we enjoyed was our cocktails and the peas.
 
Two entrees, two cocktails, one side, was a $90 meal. Not worth it. Save your money.
author: sierra s.

description:
I made a reservation a month ago and mentioned it was my grandsons graduation from Friends school, and to bring him something special, the waiter brought a one inch square of marshmallow with a candle in it on the corner of the plate of beignets we ordered..when I returned home I called and spoke with Todd the manager, who at first apologized but didn't offer a gift card or anything, actually the moment had passed, but then he said "it was a dessert, not a it big deal"..... big deals are relative and when a party of 7 comes to celebrate at your place the opportunity for PR ( which he mocked) is either won or lost..this city is full of great places and good will can make up for mediocre food. And the treatment of an unhappy patron is crucial...menu is limited and a bit dull but setting and service could help, perhaps Todd and other staff need some training...
Very disappointing and FYI Todd, never poke the bear of an unhappy grandmother about the treatment of her boy,you can't win..
Incidentally two of the party were his godparents and active city foodies,....hmmm
author: Jean S.

description: The food was just ok. The chilaquiles were a bit too tangy and the scrambled eggs came in chunks not unlike meatballs. What annoyed me most was that they seem to have a "family room" which is separated off from the main room. It's smaller. It's cold. The view isn't as nice. We were chucked into it with everyone else who had kids. Not very welcoming at all.
author: Mark F.

description:
2.5 Beautiful interior decorations. Quiet and slow after work on a Monday. The greeter was nice and friendly. Seated at the bar I thought I could get a good view of their whiskey selection and check out the bartender's mixing style. I was intrigued by the lauded "barrel aged" liquor they served. I was a little underwhelmed. Perhaps the younger man behind the bar was a little new- forgot to add ice as he mixed up my bourbon sour and with egg white I thought he maybe he's going to hand froth it. No worries, his older bar companion reminded him of the key ingredient. Simple mistake, easily forgiven. However as he placed the finishing garnish of a lemon slice on the rim, his fingers dipped into the froth on the top of the drink... I know he knows I saw this. Yet, he served it up, no qualms. I wasn't bold enough to ask for another drink, but it did turn me off from the drink. I know he was rearranging the menus before he made that drink and he certainly didn't wash his hands. I know, there must be a lot of that going on at a lot of bars on busy nights but I was a little surprised - given both the stature of this establishment and the slow pace (the next drink he made was an experiment for himself and a few more drinks for the serving staff). I'm sure you could get away with it if your customer was seated at a table far away, but its a little disconcerting when he's dipping his finger in your drink right in front of you. Nervous or not, I was disappointed. 
The aged reasons rye was tasty, but not complex. The bartender however was successful at igniting the orange peel correctly. Granted, they did have a fair selection of whiskeys, Russells, Four roses, Knob, Hudson. But nothing extensive. I appreciate that they carried Hanger One vodka, perhaps they should try out St George's Breaking and entering Bourbon. 
On to the food, just ordered a few side dishes. The roasted beets were delicious. The asparagus had a great relish with capers, red onions and a lemon vinaigrette. The chicken pate was tasty but average and the "toasts" or slices of toasted bread was a little awkward. For dessert, the beignets were a little big and not light, however the mexican chocolate sauce that accompanied them was quite tasty. With all that dining and sitting so close to the bar, you would think they would do a better job refilling water glasses.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Was looking to take my folks out for a nice meal after a brisk walk along Crissy Field. The cafe I usually go to, in the Thoreau Center, is closed on weekends. Thought we'd try something different and, throughout the assistance of Yelp, came upon the Social Club.

I like the vibe of the older Presidio buildings and the owners take advantage of the buildings bones. Even for San Francisco, I thought the prices were high for what you got. Still, it was for the parental units!

Our server was chatty and helpful.  We tried the deviled eggs (nicely done). Mom had a salad, the rest of us sandwiches. Nicely prepared, fresh ingredients, and a nice bar. Dessert looked lovely but we had plenty of goodies back home. 

This was a nice splurge but, again, on the high side for lunch. Still, it was nice to be back on the Presidio and treat the folks to a special meal.
author: David B.

description: Consistently good for a long time, PSC remains a favorite dinner spot for any occassion.  Good comfort food, well made cocktails and a nice dessert menu (try the beignets).  Good service and a cool setting.  Bar also good for after-dinner cocktails (sometimes our last stop on the way home).
author: Paul M.

description: We had a large party in for lunch on a Wednesday, and everything was wonderful. The service was on point, and the food was great.
author: Jenna P.

description: I visited the Presidio Social Club on Easter. I ordered a mimosa to begin and the Croque Madame as my entre, and really enjoyed it. My party also ordered beignets with hot chocolate -- delicious. I good spot to go with family.
author: Lauren L.

description:
Went for brunch and the food was ... And the experience was ... you know, it doesn't matter.  Why? Because I had a 6 oz glass of sparkling water as I was waiting at the bar for the rest of my party to arrive.  The kid charged me $3.99.  For water!  Then when I handed him a $5 he just stood there assuming I was tipping him and didn't want change.  For water!  I'm fine with giving gratuity when it's due but it's my f&@$ prerogative!  Anyway, I hate being ripped off.  For reference, the Bloody Mary with vodka, tomato juice, seasoning, olive, gherkin, & onion was $10.  Pretty standard but that means my sparkling water would've cost as much if I got a refill!  D-bags.  

The space is nice with lots of natural light, room for large parties, free parking on Sunday, patio seating. The meal was fine except I have a nasty aftertaste of angry from brunch....
author: kiwi l.

description:
I chose this restaurant to celebrate my 50th birthday.  What a HUGE mistake!!!  It started with the hostess lying to me about my reservation.  I had specifically requested a round table.  She told me that it was no problem at all.  In fact, we had a lengthy conversation about how my mother has a thing for round tables, and she kept saying how happy she was that they could provide one.   When we arrived, the man who greeted us told us that we could not have a round table.  He said it quite rudely.  When I mentioned what I was told above, a young woman said, oh, i'm the one who took your reservation, and all i told you was that we would do our best.  This was a total lie!!  And, there had been a private party booked a long time ago that they had committed all of their round tables to.  
That was just the beginning...
We were finally seated, and then waited over 15 minutes for a server to come.   My father ordered two bottles of wine, and we said that we weren't going to order cocktails, so that we would like one of them right away.  Again, no server......I finally flagged down a busser to get our server.  He then brought over both bottles of white at the same time, poured my father a taste, then realized that half of the table didn't even have wine glasses.   He came back with glasses and poured for everyone, EXCEPT my father, who had ordered the wine!!!
It just got worse and worse.   During our entire meal, I had to flag down bussers, because our waiter disappeared.  And NO, the restaurant was not busy.  Furthermore, the food was horrible.   Only one person at our table of 8 liked their food.  Oh, and, after a very long time, I asked for bread.  Again, had to flag down a busser to get it, and he brought a tiny plate with four pieces of bread on it for 8 people.  
This entire place was a joke.  I will tell everyone I know.  A 50th birthday is a big one, and i chose to have it here, and they knew this.   What a horrible evening!  Don't go here!
author: Maureen O.

description: We had dinner last night. I will say that the chicken was good, moist, and tender. I ordered veal, $28.00, and it was dry, over cooked and nothing special. I told the waiter about my hard piece of meat, he offered to add more sauce!!! Totally ridiculous. I could have argued to get a refund but I didn't have the energy. I was very disappointed with the ok atmosphere, the basic home food and the ridiculous prices.
author: Olga B.

description: The restaurant is cute, and the location is neat. The service was both slow and rushed. I ordered chilaquiles, which was inedible; the chips were so soggy that they were like limp pasta, and the eggs inside were overcooked. It was a mess.
author: Morris R.

description:
Mac and cheese, grilled cheese and mashed peas are awesome

The sauce for the fish was ridiculously salty.  They took the price off my bill, but the sauce was  way too salty...
author: Frank M.

description: Had a working lunch there today. The menu suited our diverse group. The out of towners liked its unique location. The service was a bit lagging during a busy lunch but once we got their attention all was good.
author: Ian C.

description: We had lunch at the club yesterday and will not return.  The burgers where well done.  Medium and medium had been ordered.  The last time we diner at this restaurant we felt the quality of the food had slipped and yesterday confirmed our belief.
author: Molly B.

description:
Went here on a Sunday afternoon - it was very busy. However I was seated right on time and service was excellent throughout our meal. The menu changes but we had the pickled vegetable sandwich, mine with the pork belly. They were absolutely outstanding - melt in your mouth delicious. Had the cookie plate for dessert - four kinds and all were delicious. There were two of each kind so it was perfect to share. 
Very cool modern space - nice views of the Presidio.
author: rhonda c.

description: Do NOT come here for dinner. Horrible dining experience for a 60th birthday. No one in our large group will ever return here.
author: Lenni R.

description:
